description.hltext_display: Hitta.se-chefen: Jag är oskyldig
description.content: I mitten av december polisanmäldes en anställd på Hitta.se för förskingring. Mannen hade köpt in stora mängder varor till bolaget för att sedan sälja dem vidare i eget namn. En knapp vecka senare fick bolagets vd Rui Brites de Sousa plötsligt sparken. Den kortfattade förklaringen var att han inte längre hade styrelsens förtroende. Det hastiga avskedet gav upphov till spekulationer om att Rui Brites de Sousa var den misstänkte i förskringsmålet på bolaget. Hitta.se har konsekvent avböjt att namnge den misstänkte. Dessutom vägrade bolagets styrelseordförande att dementera att så var fallet I en intervju med tidningen Resume förnekar nu bestämt att hans avsked skulle ha någonting med förskingringsmålet att göra. Jag kan förstå att det kan tolkas som att jag har något att göra med förskingringen. Men det kan jag ta gift på att jag inte har. En polisanmälan har lämnats in kring en helt annan person som vi valde att hålla anonym, säger han till tidningen. Han säger sig fortfarande inte ha fått någon förklaring till det hastiga avskedet. Jag vet fortfarande inte varför jag har fått sluta. Men jag har ingen som helst koppling till incidenten förutom att jag var vd under tiden som det hela skedde, säger . Hitta.se har under Rui Brites de Sousas ledning gjort mycket starka finansiella resultat. Under det tredje kvartalet i år ökade omsättningen med 23 procent till 91 miljoner kronor. Rörelseresultatet ökade till 35 miljoner kronor från 11 miljoner kronor i fjol, vilket motsvarar en marginal på 38 procent. IT24 har sökt Rui Brites de Sousa för en kommentar.

description.hltext_display: India 2nd best market for Oman's non-oil exports
Ethiopia Secures $224.3 Million of Funds to Build Power Transmission Lines
description.content:
am, by nazret.com, 89 words
Categories: Ethiopia, Energy
Ethiopia secured $224.3 million from the African Development Bank to fund the construction of four electricity transmission lines to improve its own power supply and help development in neighboring countries, the lender said.
Additional transmission capacity is “critical and timely” for Ethiopia’s industrial development, said Lamin Barrow, the AFDB’s resident representative, by phone today from the capital, Addis Ababa. The lines will connect areas in the north, east and south-west of the country, and help expedite plans to export power to Sudan and Kenya, he said.

description.hltext_display: 校園容器減量 防治登革熱有成(中央社)
description.content:
（中央社記者夏念慈高雄市22日電）南台灣延燒的登革熱疫情已趨緩，行政院衛生署副署長張上淳今天在高雄市表示，南部中小學推動容器減量有成，降低疫情傳播風險，值得中北部縣市防疫借鏡。
身兼登革熱中央流行疫情指揮中心副指揮官的張上淳，今天南下頒獎表揚台南及高雄執行容器減量的績優學校及個人。
他表示，登革熱防治要從社區環境清潔做起，容器減量更是疫情防治的釜底抽薪之計，沒有容器讓病媒蚊無處可以產卵，能有效遏止疫情蔓延。
張上淳說，從中小學校園推廣容器減量，往下扎根不僅是基層環保教育的一環，更能藉由小朋友在家庭中的影響力，強化社區執行成果。
疾管局第五分局長林立人表示，高雄及台南疫情高峰期，1個星期本土確定病例增加150例，上個星期統計下降為50例，疫情明顯緩和；可見室內外容器減量發揮成效，未來會協調環保署將容器減量列為清淨家園計畫的常規執行項目。

description.hltext_display: Helen of Troy Limited - Value
description.content:
Helen of Troy Limited (HELE) is more than just hair care products as its household products segment, including the very popular OXO brand of measuring cups and cooking tools, saw record revenue in the fiscal second quarter. Helen of Troy has attractive valuations, trading at just 10.8x forward estimates which is well under its peers at 19x.
Helen of Troy is best known for its hair dryers, curling irons, brushes, hair accessories, mirrors, hair styling products and skin care products under the licensed names Vidal Sassoon, Revlon, Dr. Scholl's, Sunbeam and its own brands of Final Net and Condition 3-in-1, among others.
But it also manufactures popular home products including kitchen tools, cutlery, tea kettles, trash cans, gardening tools, barbeque tools and kitchen mitts under the brands OXO and Good Grips.
Helen of Troy Acquires Kaz, Inc.
On Dec 9, Helen of Troy expanded its stable of brand names by acquiring Kaz, Inc. for $260 million in cash. Kaz provides health care and home environment solutions under the brand names Vicks and Braun, as well as Honeywell and Stinger.
Its products include vaporizers, humidifiers, blood pressure monitors, air purifiers, heaters and fans. Sales are in the United States and worldwide.
The deal is expected to close by the end December 2010 and is expected to be accretive to earnings in the fiscal year ending Feb 29, 2012.
Helen of Troy Reports Record Sales in the Fiscal Second Quarter
On Oct 6, Helen of Troy reported fiscal second quarter results and beat the Zacks Consensus for the 4th straight quarter. Earnings per share were 75 cents compared to the consensus of 64 cents. It made just 51 cents in the year ago quarter.
Sales jumped 7.8% to $174.8 million from $162.1 million a year ago. For 6 months, sales rose 9.4% to $334 million from $306 million. Housewares led the way in the second quarter, rising 10.2% to $55.7 million while the personal care segment jumped 6.7% to $119.1 million.
Helen of Troy still sees a challenging worldwide retail environment, but is seeing organic growth in the Housewares Segment, especially in OXO brands.
Outlook for the Third Quarter
The third quarter should be more challenging for Helen of Troy due to increasing inbound freight and commodity costs. It expects earnings to decline compared to the year ago quarter.
However, it expects the full year earnings range to be $2.70 to $2.80 per share.
Zacks Consensus Estimates Mixed
The stock declined on the guidance news but since the acquisition was announced in early December, shares have surged to a 2-year high.
Estimates have been mixed for fiscal 2011 over the last 30 days with 1 rising and 1 falling in that time. The fiscal 2011 Zacks Consensus has risen by 3 cents to $2.77 from $2.74, but had been at $2.82 per share the week before.
Still, this is earnings growth of 19.4%.
Fiscal 2012 is looking up. 2 estimates have moved higher in the past month, pushing the Zacks Consensus up to $3.21 from $3.00. That is continued earnings growth of 15.8%.
Helen of Troy is expected to report third quarter results on Jan 11, 2011.
Helen of Troy is a Value Stock
Helen of Troy is cheaper than its nearest competitors in the houseware space. Lifetime Brands (LCUT) has a forward P/E of 12.2 which is more expensive than Helen of Troy.
Helen of Troy also has a price-to-book ratio of 1.5, which is within the value parameters. Lifetime Brands has a similar P/B ratio.
Additionally, the company has a solid return on equity (ROE) of 14%, well above its peers at 9.5%.
Helen of Troy is a a Zacks #1 Rank (strong buy) stock.
Tracey Ryniec is the Value Stock Strategist for Zacks.com. She is also the Editor in charge of the market-beating Zacks Value Trader service. You can follow her at twitter.com/traceyryniec.

description.hltext_display: 古墓丽影新角色公布 劳拉的冒险不孤独
description.content:
2010-12-21 14:20 来源：新浪游戏 RSS复制链接打印
核心提示：随着时间的推移，更多关于《古墓丽影》新作的信息陆续被披露，同时玩家也开始慢慢的接受了这个年轻的劳拉。
随着时间的推移，更多关于《古墓丽影》新作的信息陆续被披露，同时玩家也开始慢慢的接受了这个年轻的劳拉。前不久制作组阐述了他们对于劳拉新形象设计的看法，向玩家表达了他们的设计理念，而在近日制作组又放出了一个新角色。
Conrad Roth
这名新角色名字叫Conrad Roth，年龄设定为52岁，国籍是英国，职业为赏金猎人以及冒险向导。在新的作品里劳拉将被扔在一个荒岛上，而Conrad Roth也恰好是被遗留在荒岛上的幸存者之一，作为一个经验老到的野外生存者，Conrad Roth不仅将给劳拉提供支援，同时也会在一定程度上扮演劳拉在野外生存方面的导师。
制作组有意定义劳拉的新符号
《古墓丽影》历代作品里很少刻画劳拉与其它角色的关系，之前我们所了解的劳拉也仅仅限于那个与古代遗迹和野兽打交道的劳拉。在新作里，制作小组有意改变这一状况，为了给玩家展现一个更鲜明的劳拉形象，制作小组打算更多的展现劳拉与其它角色的交流与互动，以刻画年轻劳拉的成长。
以前就有玩家表示，太少的人物刻画使得劳拉像一个只是被玩家在游戏里操纵的性感玩偶，而不是神秘的劳拉·克劳馥本人，也许新的作品可以改变玩家的这一印象。
劳拉不应该总是这样子
由此可见，ConradRoth应该不是唯一一个会在新作里加入的角色，相信在新的游戏里劳拉也肯定不会感到孤独。同时玩家也可以知道劳拉是怎么一步步成长为那个坚强和勇敢的性感女性冒险家。
曾经的那些古墓丽影代言人

description.hltext_display: NRW-Atheisten: Handreichung für konfessionsfreie Schüler
description.content: Lindlar (ots) - Um den Jahreswechsel wählen viele Eltern die Grundschule oder suchen nach einer passenden weiterführenden Schule für ihre Kinder. Neben Bildungsangebot, Lehrerqualifikation und Erreichbarkeit ist auch die weltanschaulich-religiöse Ausrichtung ein wichtiges Kriterium für die beständig anwachsende Zahl nichtreligiöser Eltern. Der Internationale Bund der Konfessionslosen und Atheisten (IBKA) NRW stellt in seinem Internet-Angebot einen Fragebogen für Eltern zur Verfügung, mit dem sie die Wahrung der Religionsfreiheit ihrer Kinder bei Schulleitungen erfragen können. "Die Teilnahme am konfessionellen Religionsunterricht und Schulgottesdiensten ist für Schülerinnen und Schüler freiwillig. Das regelt unser Grundgesetz. Viele Lehrerinnen, Lehrer und Schulleitungen verwenden bedeutenden Ehrgeiz darauf, die Freiwilligkeit der Teilnahme am Religionsunterricht zu behindern. Hier werden die Grundrechte der nichtreligiösen Schüler massiv verletzt!" sagt IBKA-NRW Sprecher Rainer Ponitka. "Manche Grundschulen lassen Unterrichtsfächer beim gleichen Lehrer ineinander übergehen. Der Religionsunterricht hat keine verbindlichen Zeiten im Stundenplan. Es wird Eltern massiv erschwert, ihre Kinder vor religiöser Indoktrination zu schützen." Dem Fragebogen liegt die aktuelle Gesetzes- und Erlasslage in Nordrhein-Westfalen zugrunde. Erfragt wird die Beaufsichtigung der konfessionsfreien Schüler zur Zeit des Religionsunterrichtes, die verbindlichen Zeiten des Religionsunterrichtes im Stundenplan, sowie die Häufigkeit von Gottesdiensten im Schulhalbjahr. Ponitka weiter: "Der Religionsunterricht hat die Aufgabe, die Glaubensinhalte der Religionsgemeinschaften als bestehende Wahrheiten zu vermitteln. Das hat das Bundesverfassungsgericht 1987 bestätigt. Somit kann man den Religionsunterricht als pure Mitgliederschulung der Religionsgemeinschaften bezeichnen. Nirgendwo sonst im schulischen Bereich wird so viel kriminelle Energie darauf verwendet, die bestehende Rechtslage zu umgehen und nichtreligiöse Menschen in der Ausübung ihrer Freiheitsrechte zu behindern." Der IBKA in Nordrhein-Westfalen berät seit dem Schuljahr 2007/2008 nichtreligiöse Schüler, Eltern und Lehrer und unterstützt sie in der Wahrung ihrer Religionsfreiheit. Über den IBKA: Im IBKA haben sich nichtreligiöse Menschen zusammengeschlossen, um die Weltanschauungsfreiheit und die konsequente Trennung von Staat und Religion durchzusetzen. Weiterführende Links: Fragebogen für Eltern http://www.ibka.org/frageGS-NRW Schulrundschreiben 2009/10 http://ibka.org/node/897 AG Schule des IBKA http://ibka.org/ag-schule Pressekontakt: Rainer Ponitka IBKA e.V., Landessprecher NRW Steinbach 19 51789 Lindlar Tel.: +49-(0)2266-9015244 Mobil: +49-(0)170-8122250 E-Mail: presse-nrw@ibka.org www.ibka.org/nrw http://www.presseportal.de/pm/78289/1738600/internationaler_bund_der_konfessionslosen_und_atheisten_e_v_landesverband_nrw/api

description.hltext_display: Tigers on top in one-day clash
description.content:
Tasmania claimed the first point on offer in their one-day cup match against Western Australia today, but lost both opening batsmen on the way.
The Tigers were 2-96 at the dinner break, a lead of 13 runs, with Ed Cowan 19 not out and skipper George Bailey unbeaten on 14.
Mark Cosgrove and Rhett Lockyear set a cracking pace in the early overs for the Tigers, taking the score past 60 in the 11th over.
But Lockyear was brought undone for 28 when he spooned a catch to Michael Hogan off the bowling of Nathan Coulter-Nile, while Cosgrove was caught and bowled by discarded Test batsman Marcus North for 34.
The Warriors were sent in after losing the toss and reached 1-83 at the first changeover, with Shaun Marsh unbeaten on 34 and Luke Pomersbach eight not out.
Marsh and Liam Davis batted sensibly and took the score to 70 before Davis was trapped in front off the bowling of Jason Krejza for 35.
Marsh should have been run-out on the first ball of the innings, but the throw from George Bailey was wide of stand-in keeper Travis Birt. Birt is filling in for the injured Tim Paine, who was named to play, but failed to recover in time from a finger injury.

description.hltext_display: Media Advisory: Forrester’s Technology Sales Enablement Forum, February 14-15, 2011, In San Francisco
description.content:
, (Nasdaq: FORR): WHAT: , (Nasdaq: FORR) : New Buyers, New Demands: Accelerating Sales Performance
The status quo is the enemy of technology vendors today. On the customer side, technology investment decisions have migrated from the data center to the boardroom, shifting purchasing criteria from capabilities to business outcomes. However, many firms? go-to-market strategies lag behind these new buying requirements and force salespeople to play on the same old turf ? responding to RFPs and being treated as a commodity provider.
Competitive advantage depends on purposeful collaboration and change across the organization to focus sales enablement on buyers' changing needs. At Forrester?s inaugural , marketing, sales, and product portfolio leaders will learn how to sell higher, capture wallet share, and transform their sales approach from product pushing to problem solving.
WHEN: February 14-15, 2011
WHERE: The Palace Hotel, San Francisco
2 New Montgomery Street
San Francisco, CA 94104
+1 415.512.1111 WHO: Forrester?s industry-leading analysts will be joined by featured guest speakers, including: The Forum offers three in-depth tracks designed to deliver practical tools and frameworks for end-to-end sales enablement improvement as well as the latest Forrester data and insights into enterprise technology buyers? desired business outcomes and purchase plans, including who is involved in purchase processes. Attendees will also have the opportunity to schedule One-On-One Meetings with Forrester analysts and to network with more than 200 sales, marketing, and strategy professionals.
Nine sponsors, including Platinum sponsors Jigsaw and SAVO, will participate in the Event?s Solutions Showcase.
CONTACT: Attendees who register for Forrester?s before January 7, 2011 will be eligible for a discount. To register, please call 888.343.6786. Complete Event information is available at www.forrester.com/techsales2011.
MEDIA: Members of the media can register for this Event by providing their full contact information to press@forrester.com.

description.hltext_display: 萬丹泥火山噴漿 還未平息(中央社)
description.content:
（中央社記者郭芷瑄屏東縣22日電）屏東萬丹泥火山昨天在汞污泥的堆置場噴發，使得汞污泥固化最終處理作業暫停，到中午，泥漿仍持續噴發，屏東縣政府環保局表示，到今天中午為止，沒發現有汞污泥外洩情形。
幾乎每年都會噴發1次的萬丹泥火山，昨天凌晨噴發，今年的噴發地點竟然在汞污泥的堆置場，這是汞污泥堆置近10年，泥火山首次在堆置場噴發。
以往泥火山噴發，附近居民會點火燃燒，好讓天然氣趕快燒完，停止噴漿，通常不到1天的時間，噴漿就會平息; 但今年泥火山在汞污泥堆置場噴發，環保局不敢點火，只能等待噴漿自動平息，直到今天中午，仍有1個噴發孔持續噴漿，但能量已弱許多。
環保局人員表示，目前正在進行桶裝汞污泥的重新檢測，每公斤含汞量超過260毫克的汞污泥，將送往台塑回收汞元素，汞含量低於260毫克的污泥則固化，未來當一般廢棄物，送往最終處理場掩埋，預計明年8月完成作業。
環保局表示，雖然泥火山的噴發讓檢測作業耽擱，但不會影響太大，到今天中午，也沒有發現有汞污泥和重金屬外洩情形。
屏東縣在民國88年爆發被傾倒汞污泥事件，檢察官調查，台塑公司委託的代清理廠商自民國86年開始，陸續將汞污泥傾倒在萬丹鄉和新園鄉交界的赤山巖，環保署與環保局多次與台塑協商，前年決定最終處理方式，並開始進行作業。

description.hltext_display: Flygplatsernas galna vändning - blir teleoperatörer
description.content:
Fakta
Mobilt bredband styr Arlandas wi-fi-priser
I dag kostar det 49 kr/tim att koppla upp sig i Swedavias wi-fi-nät på Arlanda. Det tredje lägsta priset bland flygplatser i Europa. Men jag tror inte vi kommer att ligga kvar på de priserna. Avgifterna styrs av priset på mobilt 3g-bredband och det är bara att se sig omkring hur de rasar just nu, säger Jan Blom. Många flygresenärer efterfrågar gratis wi-fi, enligt Jan Blom. Men det är bara flygplatserna i Bryssel och Helsingfors som har gratis wi-fi och då handlar det inte om en premiumtjänst som den vi har. Vi måste hitta nya intäktsslag för att driva vår flygplatsverksamhet. Det går inte bara att ta ut avgifter av resenärer och flygbolag. Vi måste säkerställa fler intäkter, säger Jan Blom, chef för Swedavias nystartade telekomsatsning Airport Telecom. Swedavia ansvarar för drift och utveckling av 13 svenska flygplatser. Nu har det statliga bolaget siktet inställt på att dra in 50 miljoner kronor på telekom inom ett par år. En stor del av pengarna ska komma från en stor utbyggnad av Arlanda som är på gång. Flera stora kontorsfastigheter planeras i anslutning till Sky City. I dag jobbar 16 000 personer på Arlanda, utöver Swedavias egen personal. Men 2018-2020 kommer 60 000 personer att ha sin arbetsplats på flygplatsområdet, enligt Jan Blom. Swedavia räknar med att dra in pengar på it-infrastruktur och kommunikationstjänster till de företag som etablerar sig på flygplatsen. Vi har teleoperatörsstatus och kommer att stå för fibertjänster, wi-fi-tjänster och telefoni, men även erbjuda transmissionstjänster i vårt nät som förbinder flygplatserna, säger Jan Blom. Myndigheten har monopol på att gräva ner egen nätinfrastruktur på Arlanda, som sedan andra operatörer får hyra plats i. Man kan inte gräva hur som helst ute på flygplatsen. Det är för att säkerställa flygplatsdriften, säger Jan Blom. Swedavia står också för den enda infrastrukturen för publik wi-fi på flygplatserna. Flygplatser är skyddsområden där användningen av radiobaserade nät är reglerad. Vi följer den lagstiftning som finns. Det är inga konstigheter, det är för att skydda flygfarten. Nu vid årskiftet öppnar Swedavia nya, mer utvecklade wi-fi-tjänster på sina samtliga tio flygplatser. Det nya är att vi kan roama med teleoperatörer och internationella wi-fi-operatörer, exempelvis The Cloud som har ett virtuellt nät i vårt wlan, säger Jan Blom. Tidigare hade även Teliasonera en egen wi-fi-infrastruktur på Arlanda för sin tjänst Homerun. Men nätet fick avvecklas för drygt två år sedan efter uppmärksammade konflikter med dåvarande Luftfartsverket. Men Jan Blom kallar det hela "gammalt groll" som är historia nu. Nu gäller det att kroka arm istället. Det nya wi-fi-plattformen gör att vi erbjuda Telia Homerun att roama i vårt nät. Vi hoppas att dom finns med här inom kort. Teliasonera bekräftar för CS att de för diskussioner med Swedavia. Trots att 3g-näten har hög kapacitet på Arlanda och mobiloperatörerna kör igång sina första 4g-tjänster på Arlanda i mars, anser Jan Blom att det finns en framtid för wi-fi-tjänsten. 3g-accessen kan ofta bli lite bristfällig och långsam på tätbefolkade flygplatser. Vi ger användarna 100 megabit så att man kan köra så det ryker.

description.hltext_display: Ethiopia - Death outside DC9 is ruled a homicide by medical examiner
description.content:
The D.C. medical examiner's office has ruled that the death of a man after a controversial incident outside the DC9 nightclub two months ago was a homicide, but it remains unclear whether a crime was committed during the fatal encounter.
In a statement Tuesday, the medical examiner's office said several factors contributed to the Oct. 15 death of Ali Ahmed Mohammed, 27, who allegedly threw at least one brick through the club's front window shortly after its 2 a.m. closing. Police said Mohammed was then chased by five men - four employees and a co-owner of the bar - and died after a physical encounter with them at Ninth and U streets NW.
Family of Ali Ahmed Mohammed Says Death Ruled Homicide
WASHINGTON - The D.C Medical Examiner has released the cause of death of Ali Ahmed Mohammed. Mohammed died after he was denied entry to the DC9 nightclub along the U Street corridor and returned to throw a brick through the window. The owner of the club and four others then allegedly chased and assaulted him.

description.hltext_display: 陳樹菊獲選全國好人好事代表(中廣新聞網)
description.content:
討論 (+)
調整字級：
台東善心女菜販陳樹菊，再接獲全國好人好事運動協會通知，獲選全國好人好事代表，明天將在台北接受「八德獎」的表揚。
陳樹菊女士在民國86年捐了一百萬元給母校台東仁愛國小，作為學童急難救助獎學金；5年前再將多年來賣菜的積蓄450萬元捐給母校蓋圖書館，現在她依然每天在菜市場賣菜，希望能再賺些錢幫助更多小朋友。
陳樹菊這次是由戶籍所在的台東市「建國里」推薦，經由台東縣政府呈轉中華民國表揚好人好事運動協會，經初審、複審及決審等程序，獲選全國好人好事代表，她也是台東縣唯一的獲選受獎者。
陳樹菊長年來的行善義舉，在今年已分別獲得「亞洲富比世亞太地區四傑出善心人士」、美國時代雜誌百大全球影響力人物、並獲頒教育部頒發「一等教育文化獎章」，這是臺灣教育界最高榮耀，也是歷年來唯一只有國小學歷的得獎者。
(圖片)張南雄攝

description.hltext_display: Ethiopian Man shot and killed during robbery in Denver
description.content:
am, by nazret.com, 150 words
Categories: Ethiopia, Crime
Police investigate convenience store murder
Two masked robbers ended an immigrant's dream of a better life Monday night, Denver police said.
Two suspects wearing masks and dark clothing entered the Monaco Grocery at 6622 E. Colfax Ave. in Denver just before 9 p.m., Denver police Detective John White said. One of the suspects was armed with a gun and shot the clerk working in the store.
White said the wounded man, whom friends identified as Yezew Anday, died a short time later at Denver Health Medical Center.
Tafere Ambaw, 44, said that he was a friend of Anday's and that the two of them emigrated from Ethiopia about the same time in 1992.
The grocery where Ambaw said Anday was volunteering his time is near several Ethiopian-owned businesses in a
Denver police are asking anyone with information about the incident to contact them at 720-913-2000 or Crime Stoppers at 720-913-STOP (7867).

description.hltext_display: NCAA Game Summary - Southern Miss vs. Louisville
description.content:
*** *** (Tuesday, December 21st)
Final Score: Louisville 31, Southern Miss 28
St. Petersburg, FL (Sports Network) - Chris Philpott kicked the go-ahead 36- yard field goal in the fourth quarter, and Louisville held on for a 31-28 victory over Southern Miss in the Beef 'O' Brady's Bowl.
Jeremy Wright returned a kickoff 95 yards for a touchdown earlier in the fourth to help the Cardinals (7-6) overcome a deficit and secure a winning season in head coach Charlie Strong's first year. Louisville also recorded its first postseason victory since the 2007 Orange Bowl.
Justin Burke threw for 178 yards and two touchdowns for the Cardinals, while Bilal Powell ran for 75 yards and a score.
Austin Davis passed for 205 yards and two scores for Southern Miss (8-5), which was making a ninth consecutive bowl appearance, but lost for the second straight year.
Southern Miss took a 28-21 lead on the opening play of the fourth quarter. The Golden Eagles had driven from midfield to the eight before Austin Davis completed a pass to tight end Zeke Walters on the right edge of the end zone.
But on the ensuing kickoff, Wright made his way through traffic to the left sideline, picked up one final block and sprinted into the end zone to even the game again.
Louisville forced a punt and took over deep in its own territory. Burke led the Cardinals into Southern Miss territory, but the drive stalled and Philpott kicked his field goal with 6:30 to play.
Cardinals linebacker Brandon Heath made a key third-down sack of Davis on the next Southern Miss possession, forcing a three-and-out. The failure to move the ball doomed the Golden Eagles, whose defense stopped Louisville too late. Southern Miss got the ball back with only seconds remaining and couldn't pull off a miracle play.
The Golden Eagles got out to a 14-0 lead on two first-quarter touchdowns. Quentin Pierce had a 32-yard TD reception about three minutes into the game, while Desmond Johnson scored on a 62-yard run with 10:12 left.
Louisville made up the deficit, though, by reaching the end zone three times in the second quarter.
Cameron Graham caught an 11-yard strike from Burke with 11:21 on the clock to get the Cardinals on the board. Southern Miss responded about two minutes later when Davis caught a 17-yard touchdown throw from Pierce, a wide receiver.
But Josh Chichester's 10-yard reception and Powell's six-yard run later in the half allowed Louisville to go into halftime tied, 21-21.
Game Notes
Johnson ran for 102 yards on 10 carries for Southern Miss...Louisville's Doug Beaumont led all receivers with seven catches for 57 yards...Southern Miss out-gained Louisville, 396-287, but averaged just 18.5 yards on four kickoff returns.
12/22 01:09:53 ET

description.hltext_display: Man hit by train overcame hearing loss, will be buried in Browns jersey
description.author: Tiffany Y. Latta
description.content:
TRENTON People who know William E. Kingrey say its fitting he will be buried in a Cleveland Browns jersey.
Kingrey, 44, of Camden, who was fatally struck Monday morning by a CSX train in Trenton while walking to his job site, is to be buried on Christmas Eve in his Colt McCoy No. 12 jersey. That was his favorite player. He was excited when Texas Longhorn Colt McCoy became part of the Browns. He loved it, said Kingreys pastor, the Rev. Greg Jackson of the First Southern Baptist Church in Camden.
At around 9 a.m. Monday, Kingrey, an Asplundh Tree Expert Co. worker known as Willie to his friends and family, was carrying a chain saw, a tree trimming pole and climbing gear as he crossed the train trestle over Elk Creek near the East State Street crossing. He was nearly clear of the south end of the trestle when he was struck from behind by the train headed from Cumberland, Md., to Cincinnati. He got caught on the trestle and couldnt get off the trestle in time before he was struck, said Trenton police Chief Tim Traud.
Clint Nigg, Butler County Coroners investigator, said Kingrey, who was pronounced dead at the scene, was pushed nearly 70 feet before the train stopped. Results of an autopsy performed Tuesday morning indicate Kingrey died of multiple trauma, he said. Toxicology tests were negative.
Gary Sease, a spokesman for CSX, said the train consisted of two locomotives and 40 rail cars 18 loads of mixed freight and 22 empty containers. It was traveling an estimated 50 mph at the time of the accident, Traud said.
The Occupational Safety and Health Administrations investigation into the accident will focus primarily on Kingreys employer, said Bill Wilkerson, assistant area director at OSHAs Cincinnati office. The Asplundh Tree Expert Co. office in Richmond, Ind., declined to comment.
Kingrey will be remembered as a fun-loving husband, youngest brother of three and a friend to many, who didnt let congenital hearing loss in both ears limit him, said his sister Nancy McMurray.
McMurray said her brother was born premature and weighed just over 2 pounds. Because of his hearing loss, Kingrey attended two schools and was a graduate of both Meadowdale and Eaton high schools. Still, he was always happy, cuttin up, and if you wanted anything done, hed try to help you do it, McMurray, 58, of West Alexandria said.
Kingrey also was known as one of the founders of the Lake Lakengren Ski Club along with his late father, Cletus, and for his love of breakdancing and water skiing. He could ski barefooted. He could breakdance. He just had to move, McMurray said with a laugh.
McMurray said Kingrey didnt wear hearing aids but got along fine without them, though others said people had to speak loudly when talking to him, she said. Jackson, who wouldnt speculate on whether Kingreys hearing loss was a factor in the accident, said his death was a shock to everyone who knew him. Services on Friday will be especially tough because of the holidays, he said. For some things in life there just isnt an answer for. We just have to trust God. Some things we just dont understand, but what we do know is that there is hope beyond the grave, Jackson said. Visitation is 5 to 8 p.m. Thursday at the Girton Schmidt & Boucher Gard Funeral Home, 226 W. Main St., Eaton. Funeral is 11 a.m. Friday at the funeral home, with burial at Fairview Cemetery in West Alexandria.
Staff Writers Lauren Pack, Hannah Poturalski and Denise Wilson contributed to this report. Staff Writers Lauren Pack, Hannah Poturalski and Denise Wilson contributed to this report. Start your day with top headlines in your inbox and get breaking news e-mail alerts at any time by subscribing to our Headlines e-mail newsletter. description.hltext_display: Flexibel it-tekniker/support till kund i centrala Stockholmstockholm, Sverige Academic Work Sweden AB
description.content:
Ansök på arbetsgivarens hemsida (öppnas i ett nytt fönster).
Beskrivning
Academic Work söker för kunds räkning en flexibel it-tekniker/support som ska se över vår kunds kunders IT-miljö. Vår kund är centralt belägen i Stockholm och tillhandahåller slagkraftiga lösningar inom IT, egenutvecklade system inom datalagring och kommunikation. Företaget har mångårig erfarenhet inom bank & finans, försäkring och media.
Uppdraget är en del av vår personaluthyrning vilket innebär att du kommer att vara anställd av Academic Work men arbeta som konsult hos ett av våra kundföretag.
Arbetsuppgifter:
Som it-tekniker/support hos vår kund kommer du att ansvara för cirka 5 - 10 av företagets kunder. Din huvudsakliga arbetsuppgift är att se över kundernas IT-miljö och komma med förändrings, förbättrings och effektiviseringsförslag. Du kommer att jobba inhouse men också vara på plats ute hos företagets kunder. Det kommer att finnas seniora kollegor som du kan ventilera idéer med men du kommer att arbeta väldigt självständigt.
Du kommer till exempel att:
• Agera rådgivare och hjälpa kunderna med att ta in nya lösningar
• Supporta kunder via telefon, mail och fjärrsupport
• Hantera incidenter och problem på plats
• Sköta förvaltningen av de installerade produkterna
Utvecklingsmöjligheter:
Du kommer få möjligheten att utvecklas i din yrkesroll och detta är också ett perfekt tillfälle för dig att bredda ditt kontaktnät. Vår kund satsar mycket på kompetensutveckling och utvecklingsmöjligheterna inom företaget är väldigt stora.
VI SÖKER DIG SOM
Har examen inom IT. Vi ser att du tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet från liknande arbetsuppgifter, men viktigast är att du har övergripande nätverkskunskaper.
Du ska ha erfarenhet/kunskap inom:
• Windows (XP, Vista och 7) och Mac
• Windows Office 2003/2007/2010
• Office för Mac 2008/2011
• Grundläggande kunskaper i Windows Server 2003/2007 samt MS Exchange
• Drift, backup, säkerhet
Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet från liknande arbetsuppgifter tidigare och om du har arbetat inom IT bank eller finansiering, detta är dock inget krav.
För att lyckas i den här rollen ser vi att du är flexibel, serviceinriktad och lyhörd då du ska hantera kunder i olika situationer. Vi ser gärna att du har arbetat mycket självgående och är bekväm i kontakten med kund. Eftersom du kommer att ha mycket kundkontakt ser vi att du är social och har lätt för att skapa relationer. Du som söker har god kunskap i svenska och engelska då det tillkommer kontakt och dokumentering på båda språken.
Ett utdrag ur belastningsregistret, en kreditupplysning kommer att göras i samband med anställning.
Start: Omgående
Omfattning: Deltid, flexibelt då du kan bli inringd samma dag
Arbetstid: Främst kontorstider men ibland utanför kontorstid
Plats: Centrala Stockholm
Lön: Timlön
Referensnummer: LOH50513
Urval: Sker löpande
Vi är Home of the Young Professionals - ett bemanningsföretag med siktet inställt på att bli världens största arbetsgivare för högskolestudenter och unga akademiker. Vi vänder oss till dig som studerar eller är färdig med dina studier och har upp till fem års arbetslivserfarenhet. Hos oss kan du arbeta som konsult på specifika kunduppdrag eller bli anställd direkt hos ett kundföretag via vår rekryteringsverksamhet. Som arbetssökande kan du dessutom ansöka om att få en jobbcoach hos oss. Läs mer på www.academicwork.se

description.hltext_display: Local report ? Three spikers honored
description.content:
YAKIMA ? Three local athletes have earned All-American status in community college volleyball.
Daria Winckler, a Davis graduate playing at Wenatchee Valley College, was named to the American Volleyball Coaches Association (AVCA) All-American first team as a setter-hitter. Winckler is a sophomore.
From Yakima Valley, which placed third in last month’s NWAACC Tournament, freshmen Tori Fisher and Veronica Sanchez were named to the second team.
Fisher is an outside hitter from Eisenhower while Sanchez is a libero from Selah. Best of the West

description.hltext_display: Get over it, Siddle tells Poms
description.content:
Australia pace bowler Peter Siddle branded England as sore losers today, saying they were only complaining about sledging because they lost the Perth Test.
Siddle also turned up the heat on James Anderson, challenging the mouthy England quick to prove his toughness by carrying a side-strain injury into the fourth Ashes Test starting on Sunday at the MCG.
England batsman Matt Prior was furious during last week's third Test when he was bowled by Siddle and then the Australian gave him a verbal send-off.
Prior appeared to gesture for Siddle to join him later on in the car park so they could sort it out man to man, although Prior has denied this in a British newspaper column.
He said Siddle's comments had annoyed him and weren't necessary.
Prior said Siddle had got him out in "lucky" fashion and should have shut his mouth.
"There are not many boxing matches when a guy knocks someone out and then kicks him while he's on the floor," Prior wrote in his column in The Independent newspaper.
However Siddle said Prior had indeed asked him out the back for a fight and before he could respond, several of his team-mates had put up their hands.
"Yeah I think he did (suggest having a fight) in the end," Siddle told a Cricket Victoria luncheon on Wednesday.
Asked if he would have handled himself okay, the strongly built former junior wood-chopper grinned: "I'd back myself in."
Siddle said sledging was part of the game and last week's third Test was no worse than any other Ashes contest.
Speaking later at a press conference, Siddle added: "We won the game. That's why they're making such a big deal of it."
The Victorian quick said captain Ricky Ponting deliberately tried to get him fired-up during games.
"They're at us, we're at them. It just makes the game a bit more lively and no doubt the spectators like to see it," Siddle said.
"Ricky knows that's when I can perform at my best and I can get the rest of the boys going.
"I enjoy having some fun with the batters."
Siddle was also having fun with England's bowlers, calling Anderson's toughness into question with the five-match series at one-all.
"It just depends how tough the person is I guess. That's probably the biggest thing with it all," Siddle said when asked about Anderson's side strain.
"If he's tough enough to bowl through it, he does. If not, he misses the game.
"It's hard work but you never want to miss a Test match for your country. I guess we'll have to wait and see."
Siddle also said Anderson does a lot of sledging but misses the mark.
"The best is probably Graeme Swann. He's pretty funny," he said.
Siddle, who took 1-25 and 0-8 from a total of 13 overs in Perth, said he deserved to stay in the side for the Melbourne Test.
The other option is dropping either Siddle or Ben Hilfenhaus (0-53 and 1-16) for uncapped left-arm spinner Michael Beer.
"The four quicks got it done over in Perth," Siddle said, adding there were early indications that the MCG pitch would have some life for the quicker bowlers.
Medium-pacer Shane Watson and leg-spinner Steve Smith didn't bowl in Perth but Siddle said the two all-rounders could play big roles with the ball in the fourth Test.
"So it's not as if we haven't got a spinner playing in the side," Siddle said.
"Four quicks is definitely a good option."
Siddle said he expected Ponting to play on Sunday despite a fractured little finger.

description.hltext_display: 《赵丹》开播 王雨揭开明星儿子“赵茅”面纱
description.author: sohu.com
description.content:
搜狐娱乐讯 昨晚，大型电视剧《赵丹》正式在央视八套播出。该剧是为纪念著名电影表演艺术家赵丹诞辰90周年而拍摄，剧中首次披露了赵丹儿子赵茅的真实经历。年青演员王雨出演“赵茅”一角。
赵茅是电影明星赵丹和第一任妻子叶露茜的儿子，但人们对其生平所知甚少。赵茅长在上海，幼年却被送入孤儿院，随后经历父母离异，待成年从电影学院毕业后，事业发展不顺利，感情之路也坎坷重重，甚至在父亲赵丹死后连追悼会都被后妈阻止参加。
在电视剧《赵丹》中饰演“赵茅”的是青年演员王雨。王雨自中戏毕业后，星途顺利，先后接拍电视剧《海上传奇》《大祠堂》《同龄人》《燃烧的生命》《娘家的故事》 据悉，王雨将于1月初进驻刘江导演新剧《策反者》的剧组，与吴秀波合作出演。更多详细情况，请关注后续报道。
上搜狐微博 与明星对话

description.hltext_display: Microsoft meddelade i går
description.content: I ett pressmeddelande under gårdagen uppger Microsoft att det hittills har sålts 1,5 miljoner smartphones med företagets nya mobiloperativsystem, , sedan det släpptes i oktober. Microsofts marknadsföringschef för Windows Phone, Achim Berg, uppger att försäljningen har mött företagets förväntningar och ligger i linje med vad många andra konkurrerande produkter sålt under sina första månader. Försäljningen har gått bra och har mött våra förväntningar, speciellt jämfört med andra konkurrerande plattformar, uppger Achim Berg i ett pressmeddelande. Enligt Achim Berg hade Microsoft satt upp realistiska mål för med tanke på den stora konkurrensen på marknaden för smartphones. Med startade vi om från början. Det är en annorlunda typ av telefon och framgångarna kommer endast att kunna mätas på längre sikt, säger Achim Berg. Enligt Ramon Llamas på IDC gick det trögt med försäljningen av i början men har senare ökat med tiden tack vare stark marknadsföring. Jag tycker inte att försäljningen har gått dåligt för , men den ligger inte i samma kategori som exempelvis Android eller Iphone, säger Jack Gold på analysföretaget J. Gold Associates. Enligt Jack Gold måste Microsoft öka sin försäljning ordentligt de närmaste 12 månaderna om satsningen på smartphones ska vara värt mödan. Jag vet inte vilka siffror Microsoft hoppas på, men inom de närmaste åtta till tolv månaderna försäljningen öka. Annars måste Microsoft titta sig självt i spegeln och fråga om är för dyrt att satsa på, säger Jack Gold. När Apple släppte den första versionen av Iphone sålde företaget 1,4 miljoner enheter de första tre månaderna. Under det tredje kvartalet 2010 som avslutades den 30 september sålde Apple 14,1 miljoner Iphones. Google meddelade för några veckor sedan att cirka 300 000 Androidtelefoner aktiveras varje dag. IDG News

description.hltext_display: Mayor keeps tight lip under oath on Sunshine issue
description.content:
ISLAMORADA -- Mayor Michael Reckwerdt has declined to answer questions under oath about whether he sometimes entertains members of the Village Council in a back room at his Hungry Tarpon restaurant.
Lawyer Maurice Kutner, representing the mayor's estranged wife Annie in the couple's divorce case, posed the question in a Dec. 2 deposition.
"Don't answer that," advised Reckwerdt's attorney Jay Hershoff.
"I should," countered Reckwerdt, before going on to refuse a response.
"You are not answering whether you bring people into that restaurant and feed them free?" Kutner continued.
"No," the mayor responded.
In an interview last week, Reckwerdt said he declined to answer the questions because Hershoff has advised him to keep his council and private lives separate.
Though not under oath, he did tell the Free Press that he has not held meetings with council members at the Hungry Tarpon or his Robbie's Marina.
"No. No," Reckwerdt said when the question was posed.
The Monroe County State Attorney's Office is investigating Reckwerdt, Vice Mayor Don Achenberg, Councilmen Ken Philipson and Dave Purdo, and recently resigned Councilman Bob Johnson for possible violations of Florida's open meeting laws, known as the Sunshine Law.
The law prohibits public officials from talking outside of public meetings about matters that may come before them for a vote.
Prosecutors began looking into the matter after the council's rapid approval with little discussion of a $200,000 buyout of the contract of former Village Manager Ken Fields in September.
Assistant State Attorney Mark Wilson, however, has acknowledged that it is unlikely he will bring a case.

event_or_fact.property: he declined to answer the questions because Hershoff has advised him to keep his council and private lives separate
he has not held meetings with council members at the Hungry Tarpon or his Robbie's Marina.
it is unlikely he will bring a case.

description.hltext_display: Keri Hilson Explains Why 'No Boys Allowed?'
description.content: : Singer Keri Hilson spoke out about her new album on the block 'No Boys Allowed', the justification of the title and her favorite song from the list. In a statement to the media, Keri Hilson said that gone are the days when she fell in love with boys. The 28 year old R&B singer is of the opinion that it is a man for her now. Not that she opens up about any personal details of her life, Keri Hilson has already made it clear that it is not her personal life but her contribution in the field of music that should make headlines for the media.Returning to No Boys Allowed, Keri Hilson tells us that there are certain things in life which can be accomplished by men alone. Neither a woman nor a boy can fill up the void which men leave behind. And since Keri Hilson has spoken about the female in several of her previous albums, the singer decided to focus on the men in her album No Boys Allowed which has hit stands in the recent past.Now that we have heard about the justification of the title, we ask her to pick up one song, her favorite track from the album. Keri Hilson strongly refutes choosing between her babies, all of whom she loves equally and dearly. We hope that the listeners too will find the album No Boys Allowed as lovely as Keri Hilson describes them to be.

event_or_fact.property: gone are the days when she fell in love with boys.
there are certain things in life which can be accomplished by men alone.

description.hltext_display: 1,150 will work to build on Hemlock plant in Clarksville
description.content:
CLARKSVILLE, Tenn. — Officials say 1,150 workers are being employed to build a polysilicon plant in Clarksville, and that number is expected to increase.
The $1.2 billion Hemlock Semiconductor facility is scheduled to be finished in 2012, with production expected to start later that year.
Meanwhile, officials say the construction work force at the site is expected to peak at 1,500 by the middle of next year.
Hemlock has also started a training program for production operators.
Michigan-based Hemlock Semiconductor is a joint venture between Dow Corning Corp. and two Japanese companies, Shin-Etsu Handotai Co. and Mitsubishi Materials Corp.
Polysilicon is a raw material used to make solar cells and semiconductor devices.

description.hltext_display: 闫学晶献唱国剧盛典 红色裙装显时尚
description.author: sohu.com
description.content:
搜狐娱乐讯 近日，著名演员闫学晶亮相由安徽卫视主办的“2010国剧盛典”。当天，闫学晶身着亮丽红色裙装亮相，尽显优雅迷人女人味。现场，闫学晶不仅倾情献唱电视剧《乡村爱情》的主题曲《谁是我的新郎》，还受邀作为颁奖嘉宾颁发最佳编剧奖。
一直以来，著名演员闫学晶塑造的荧屏形象大多是“刀子嘴豆腐心”的女人，《小姨多鹤》中的那个虽然说话直来直去，爱吃醋耍小脾气，可是带人实心，从心里深爱着自己的家庭丈夫孩子的东北媳妇朱小环；《满堂爹娘》中面对十四位爹娘束手无策哭笑不得的孝顺儿媳宋丹红；再到即将在2011年1月全国正式上星的电视剧《女人当官》，剧中，闫学晶为了演好女村官杨桂花这个角色，40年以来第一次以短发造型亮相，尽显巾帼不让须眉的干练气质。
能够作为嘉宾参加本届国剧盛典，闫学晶坦言非常开心，并希望继续塑造出更多、更好地荧屏人物奉献给喜欢她的观众朋友。俗话说，女人四十一枝花，如今事业如日中天、家庭幸福美满的闫学晶恰似一朵鲜花般美丽绽放。

description.hltext_display: Dollar Tree, Inc. - Momentum
description.content:
Dollar Tree, Inc. (DLTR) continues to trade near its multi-year high at $57.06 on the heels of a solid Q3 earnings surprise of 18%. With consumers still flocking to discount retailers in the shaky economic recovery, this Zacks #1 rank stock has momentum to spare.
Company Description
Dollar Tree, Inc. operates discount variety stores in the US with most merchandise priced for $1. The company was founded in 1986 and has a market cap of $7.04 billion.
Discount retailers have been strong for the last two years as consumers search for value in an uncertain economic environment. That trend showed up in Dollar Tree's Q3 results from mid November that handily beat expectations.
Third-Quarter Results
Revenue for the period was up 14% from last year to $1.43 billion. Earnings also came in strong at 73 cents, 18% ahead of the Zacks Consensus Estimate, where the company now has an average earnings surprise of 11.5% over the last four quarters.
The company noted that it saw strength in a broad range of its products, including food, house wares, beauty supplies and home products, with increased customer traffic and a higher average ticket price providing support.
Dollar Tree's operating margin was also on the upswing, increasing 130 bps from last year on a 20bps gain in gross margin and 110 bps reduction in expenses.
Balance Sheet
The company emerged from the good quarter with its strong balance sheet full in tact, with cash and equivalents of $310 million against total debt of $267 million.
Estimates Up
We saw some solid movement in estimates off the good quarter, with the current year up 14 cents to $3.21 while the next-year estimate gained 20 cents to $3.68, a solid 14.5% growth projection.
Valuation
But in spite of the gains, the valuation picture is still in check, with a forward P/E of 17.5X, in line with the industry average.
6-Month Chart
On the chart, shares have been grinding higher with the market since early September, recently hitting a new all-time high at $57.02 on the good quarter. The stochastic below the chart is signaling that shares are trading safely away from over-bought territory. Take a look below.
Michael Vodicka is the Momentum Stock Strategist for Zacks.com. He is also the Editor in charge of the new Zacks Momentum Trader Service.

description.hltext_display: Sheriff disciplines sergeant, six others
description.content:
KEY LARGO -- The Monroe County Sheriff's Office sergeant whose unavailability on the night of June 22 set off a chain of events that culminated in the fatal crash of Deputy Melissa Powers has been suspened from the force for 21 work days.
Tom Kiffney may use vacation hours to account for half of the suspension, while the other half will be unpaid.
MCSO dispatch had been unable to reach Kiffney for at least five minutes on that June night when Powers set off toward Key Largo's Pennekamp Park, where he was last known to have been.
The deputy, 36, died when she lost control of her vehicle and collided with a parked truck while driving in excess of 100 mph.
A Sheriff's Office Internal Affairs report, released in October, concluded that Kiffney had stopped for 40 minutes at his gun shop in Key Largo while on duty that night to use the bathroom. The sergeant didn't have his cell phone with him in the store and he had his radio tuned to a channel to run tags, rather than the standard channel dispatch uses for alerts.
Kiffney's sanction, which his lieutenant Nancy Alvarez signed off on last week, was imposed for a finding of neglect of duty and improper conduct. More specifcally, he was cited for for failing to monitor his calls, failing to communicate with his deputies via radio and failing to notify dispatch when he left his car.
He declined to comment in the official form used to impose the punishment, called a supervisory review document.
On Monday, the MCSO delcined to comment on Kiffney's suspension, as well as punishments doled out to six other employees in relation to the events surrounding Powers' death.
Among those six are the four shift supervisors at the emergency dispatch center in Marathon, as well as their boss, Communications Division Director Anne Leonard.
Undersheriff Rick Ramsay suspended Leonard for eight hours without pay for failing to take proper steps to notify the MCSO IT Department that the countywide GPS tracking system was down.
In October's Internal Affairs report, inspector Donnie Elomina found that as Powers raced to find the missing Kiffney, dispatch employees were watching television rather than using that TV screen to monitor officers' locations via a GPS-enabled video tracking system.
The video system, called SmartMap, hadn't been working for several months prior to the Powers incident, Elomina found. And Leonard told him that as a result she had been allowing employees to watch television instead for approximately two months.
The four dispatch supervisors, Terri Story, Yvonne Sprinkle, Lynn Faircloth and Carolina Diesen, received their punishments from Leonard herself. She handed each of them a Letter of Reprimand for failing to document conversations they might have had with the IT Department about the faltering GPS system.
Also disciplined with a Letter of Reprimand was Deputy Darnell Durham, who like Powers, drove in emergency mode in search of Kiffney on June 22.
Durham was reprimanded for failing to notify dispatchers that he was responding to the incident with lights and sirens. Unlike Kiffney, Leonard and the four dispatch supervisors, Durham officially voiced his disagreement with the penalty in the supervisory review document.
"My actions that night were not intentional to break policy," he wrote. "My main concern was to provide a quick response, but also a safe one."
As a result of Powers' passing, the MCSO has instituted several new policies, including one requiring patrol officers to get their supervisor's permission before responding to calls at high speed and another one barring officers who own businesses from frequenting that locale while on duty.
In addition, dispatch must attempt to reach missing officers on all MCSO frequencies and they must also contact officers if their GPS units are turned off or not functioning.

event_or_fact.property: as a result she had been allowing employees to watch television instead for approximately two months.
My actions that night were not intentional to break policy; My main concern was to provide a quick response, but also a safe one.

description.hltext_display: Tulospalkkiot piti maksaa laittomasta lakosta
description.content:
Työnantaja ei olisi saanut jättää tulospalkkioita maksamatta laittomaan työtaisteluun osallistuneille, katsoo korkein oikeus. Se määräsi Stora Enson Inkeroisten tehtaan maksamaan tulospalkkiot noin kolmellekymmenelle vuonna 2006 lakkoilleelle työntekijälle.
Yhtiö oli kirjannut tulospalkkiojärjestelmään ehdon, jonka mukaan laittoman työtaistelun aiheuttamat menetykset vähennettiin siihen osallistuneiden tulospalkkioista. Korkeimman oikeuden mukaan yhtiö pyrki näin laittomasti rajoittamaan työntekijöiden yhdistymisvapautta.

description.hltext_display: Swedavia, tidigare Luftfartsverket, satsar
description.content:
Fakta
Mobilt bredband styr Arlandas wi-fi-priser
I dag kostar det 49 kr/tim att koppla upp sig i Swedavias wi-fi-nät på Arlanda. Det tredje lägsta priset bland flygplatser i Europa. Men jag tror inte vi kommer att ligga kvar på de priserna. Avgifterna styrs av priset på mobilt 3g-bredband och det är bara att se sig omkring hur de rasar just nu, säger Jan Blom. Många flygresenärer efterfrågar gratis wi-fi, enligt Jan Blom. Men det är bara flygplatserna i Bryssel och Helsingfors som har gratis wi-fi och då handlar det inte om en premiumtjänst som den vi har. Vi måste hitta nya intäktsslag för att driva vår flygplatsverksamhet. Det går inte bara att ta ut avgifter av resenärer och flygbolag. Vi måste säkerställa fler intäkter, säger Jan Blom, chef för Swedavias nystartade telekomsatsning Airport Telecom. Swedavia ansvarar för drift och utveckling av 13 svenska flygplatser. Nu har det statliga bolaget siktet inställt på att dra in 50 miljoner kronor på telekom inom ett par år. En stor del av pengarna ska komma från en stor utbyggnad av Arlanda som är på gång. Flera stora kontorsfastigheter planeras i anslutning till Sky City. I dag jobbar 16 000 personer på Arlanda, utöver Swedavias egen personal. Men 2018-2020 kommer 60 000 personer att ha sin arbetsplats på flygplatsområdet, enligt Jan Blom. Swedavia räknar med att dra in pengar på it-infrastruktur och kommunikationstjänster till de företag som etablerar sig på flygplatsen. Vi har teleoperatörsstatus och kommer att stå för fibertjänster, wi-fi-tjänster och telefoni, men även erbjuda transmissionstjänster i vårt nät som förbinder flygplatserna, säger Jan Blom. Myndigheten har monopol på att gräva ner egen nätinfrastruktur på Arlanda, som sedan andra operatörer får hyra plats i. Man kan inte gräva hur som helst ute på flygplatsen. Det är för att säkerställa flygplatsdriften, säger Jan Blom. Swedavia står också för den enda infrastrukturen för publik wi-fi på flygplatserna. Flygplatser är skyddsområden där användningen av radiobaserade nät är reglerad. Vi följer den lagstiftning som finns. Det är inga konstigheter, det är för att skydda flygfarten. Nu vid årskiftet öppnar Swedavia nya, mer utvecklade wi-fi-tjänster på sina samtliga tio flygplatser. Det nya är att vi kan roama med teleoperatörer och internationella wi-fi-operatörer, exempelvis The Cloud som har ett virtuellt nät i vårt wlan, säger Jan Blom. Tidigare hade även Teliasonera en egen wi-fi-infrastruktur på Arlanda för sin tjänst Homerun. Men nätet fick avvecklas för drygt två år sedan efter uppmärksammade konflikter med dåvarande Luftfartsverket. Men Jan Blom kallar det hela "gammalt groll" som är historia nu. Nu gäller det att kroka arm istället. Det nya wi-fi-plattformen gör att vi erbjuda Telia Homerun att roama i vårt nät. Vi hoppas att dom finns med här inom kort. Teliasonera bekräftar för CS att de för diskussioner med Swedavia. Trots att 3g-näten har hög kapacitet på Arlanda och mobiloperatörerna kör igång sina första 4g-tjänster på Arlanda i mars, anser Jan Blom att det finns en framtid för wi-fi-tjänsten. 3g-accessen kan ofta bli lite bristfällig och långsam på tätbefolkade flygplatser. Vi ger användarna 100 megabit så att man kan köra så det ryker.

description.hltext_display: Get over it, Siddle tells Poms
description.author: Greg Buckle
description.content:
Australia pace bowler Peter Siddle branded England as sore losers on Wednesday, saying they were only complaining about sledging because they lost the Perth Test.
Siddle also turned up the heat on James Anderson, challenging the mouthy England quick to prove his toughness by carrying a side-strain injury into the fourth Ashes Test starting on Sunday at the MCG.
England batsman Matt Prior was furious during last week's third Test when he was bowled by Siddle and then the Australian gave him a verbal send-off.
Prior appeared to gesture for Siddle to join him later on in the car park so they could sort it out man to man, although Prior has denied this in a British newspaper column.
He said Siddle's comments had annoyed him and weren't necessary.
Prior said Siddle had got him out in "lucky" fashion and should have shut his mouth.
"There are not many boxing matches when a guy knocks someone out and then kicks him while he's on the floor," Prior wrote in his column in The Independent newspaper.
However Siddle said Prior had indeed asked him out the back for a fight and before he could respond, several of his team-mates had put up their hands.
"Yeah I think he did (suggest having a fight) in the end," Siddle told a Cricket Victoria luncheon on Wednesday.
Asked if he would have handled himself okay, the strongly built former junior wood-chopper grinned: "I'd back myself in."
Siddle said sledging was part of the game and last week's third Test was no worse than any other Ashes contest.
Speaking later at a press conference, Siddle added: "We won the game. That's why they're making such a big deal of it."
The Victorian quick said captain Ricky Ponting deliberately tried to get him fired-up during games.
"They're at us, we're at them. It just makes the game a bit more lively and no doubt the spectators like to see it," Siddle said.
"Ricky knows that's when I can perform at my best and I can get the rest of the boys going.
"I enjoy having some fun with the batters."
Siddle was also having fun with England's bowlers, calling Anderson's toughness into question with the five-match series at one-all.
"It just depends how tough the person is I guess. That's probably the biggest thing with it all," Siddle said when asked about Anderson's side strain.
"If he's tough enough to bowl through it, he does. If not, he misses the game.
"It's hard work but you never want to miss a Test match for your country. I guess we'll have to wait and see."
Siddle also said Anderson does a lot of sledging but misses the mark.
"The best is probably Graeme Swann. He's pretty funny," he said.
Siddle, who took 1-25 and 0-8 from a total of 13 overs in Perth, said he deserved to stay in the side for the Melbourne Test.
The other option is dropping either Siddle or Ben Hilfenhaus (0-53 and 1-16) for uncapped left-arm spinner Michael Beer.
"The four quicks got it done over in Perth," Siddle said, adding there were early indications that the MCG pitch would have some life for the quicker bowlers.
Medium-pacer Shane Watson and leg-spinner Steve Smith didn't bowl in Perth but Siddle said the two all-rounders could play big roles with the ball in the fourth Test.
"So it's not as if we haven't got a spinner playing in the side," Siddle said.
"Four quicks is definitely a good option."
Siddle said he expected Ponting to play on Sunday despite a fractured little finger.

description.hltext_display: Bonham Police arrest 12 on drug charges
description.content:
Bonham Police report the arrest of twelve persons on December 9 on a citywide warrant service for drug charges. The warrants were the results of several months of an investigation involving persons dealing in the selling of prescription medication, methamphetamine, and marijuana.
Those arrested and charged with Delivery of a Controlled Substance: Lorri Ritter Roger, age 46, Kathy Carroll Gilmore, age 41, Billy James Gilmore, age 42, Melvin Glynn Tinniel, age 52, Christopher ONeal Frazier, age 23, Latrice Genett Hunter, age 26, Billie Jo Womack, age 26, Christina Renea Gannon, age 26, Mary Todd Allen, age 68, Lasonya Sneed, age 41, Catherine Susann Chapman, age 65 and James Dwayne Shelton, age 52.
The operation began to identify and target individuals who were selling prescription medication, which has become an ever increasing problem. Much of the illicit drug use today deals with individuals who sell their prescription medication to any and all willing to pay the price.

description.hltext_display: SEMO breaks losing streak at Tech
description.content:
Email linkPost comment Blog archive
What a huge victory for the SEMO men's basketball team tonight, winning for the first time at Tennessee Tech in more than a decade.
SEMO's 77-75 triumph was its first victory in Cookeville, Tenn., since the NCAA tournament season of 1999-2000.
The Redhawks have now won three straight after an 0-10 start. More importantly, they have evened their OVC record at 2-2 which isn't bad considering only one of the league's 10 teams -- Austin Peay -- hasn't yet suffered a conference loss.
Marland Smith has come on after a slow start and Cameron Butler is giving the Redhawks a lot despite battling painful foot problems. Those have been two of many keys during the winning streak.
SEMO is still very banged up and short on numbers so there is no telling what lies ahead.
But it's hard to question the character and heart of the Redhawks.

description.hltext_display: Louisville tops Southern Miss in Beef 'O' Brady's Bowl
description.content:
=== ===
St. Petersburg, FL (Sports Network) - Chris Philpott kicked the go-ahead 36- yard field goal in the fourth quarter, and Louisville held on for a 31-28 victory over Southern Miss in the Beef 'O' Brady's Bowl.
Jeremy Wright returned a kickoff 95 yards for a touchdown earlier in the fourth to help the Cardinals (7-6) overcome a deficit and secure a winning season in head coach Charlie Strong's first year. Louisville also recorded its first postseason victory since the 2007 Orange Bowl.
Justin Burke threw for 178 yards and two touchdowns for the Cardinals, while Bilal Powell ran for 75 yards and a score.
Austin Davis passed for 205 yards and two scores for Southern Miss (8-5), which was making a ninth consecutive bowl appearance, but lost for the second straight year.
Southern Miss took a 28-21 lead on the opening play of the fourth quarter. The Golden Eagles had driven from midfield to the eight before Austin Davis completed a pass to tight end Zeke Walters on the right edge of the end zone.
But on the ensuing kickoff, Wright made his way through traffic to the left sideline, picked up one final block and sprinted into the end zone to even the game again.
Louisville forced a punt and took over deep in its own territory. Burke led the Cardinals into Southern Miss territory, but the drive stalled and Philpott kicked his field goal with 6:30 to play.
Cardinals linebacker Brandon Heath made a key third-down sack of Davis on the next Southern Miss possession, forcing a three-and-out. The failure to move the ball doomed the Golden Eagles, whose defense stopped Louisville too late. Southern Miss got the ball back with only seconds remaining and couldn't pull off a miracle play.
The Golden Eagles got out to a 14-0 lead on two first-quarter touchdowns. Quentin Pierce had a 32-yard TD reception about three minutes into the game, while Desmond Johnson scored on a 62-yard run with 10:12 left.
Louisville made up the deficit, though, by reaching the end zone three times in the second quarter.
Cameron Graham caught an 11-yard strike from Burke with 11:21 on the clock to get the Cardinals on the board. Southern Miss responded about two minutes later when Davis caught a 17-yard touchdown throw from Pierce, a wide receiver.
But Josh Chichester's 10-yard reception and Powell's six-yard run later in the half allowed Louisville to go into halftime tied, 21-21.
Game Notes
Johnson ran for 102 yards on 10 carries for Southern Miss...Louisville's Doug Beaumont led all receivers with seven catches for 57 yards...Southern Miss out-gained Louisville, 396-287, but averaged just 18.5 yards on four kickoff returns.
12/22 01:11:22 ET

description.hltext_display: Terreno Realty Corporation Acquires Building in Miami Lakes for $7.8 Million
description.content:
Terreno Realty Corporation (NYSE:TRNO) acquired an industrial property located in Miami Lakes, Florida on December 20, 2010 for a purchase price of approximately $7.8 million. The Company utilized cash on hand to fund the acquisition.
The property consists of one multi?tenant industrial building containing approximately 195,000 square feet. The property is currently 9% leased to one tenant. The estimated stabilized cap rate of the property is 7.6%.
Estimated stabilized cap rates are calculated as annualized cash basis net operating income stabilized to market occupancy (generally 95%) divided by total acquisition cost. Total acquisition cost includes the initial purchase price, the effects of marking assumed debt to market, buyer?s due diligence and closing costs, estimated near-term capital expenditures and leasing costs necessary to achieve stabilization.
Terreno Realty Corporation is an acquirer, owner and operator of industrial real estate located in six major coastal U.S. markets: Los Angeles Area; Northern New Jersey/New York City; San Francisco Bay Area; Seattle Area; Miami Area; and Washington, D.C./Baltimore.
Additional information about Terreno Realty Corporation is available on the company?s web site at www.terreno.com.
Forward-Looking Statements
This press release contains forward-looking statements within the meaning of the federal securities laws. We caution investors that forward-looking statements are based on management?s beliefs and on assumptions made by, and information currently available to, management. When used, the words ?anticipate?, ?believe?, ?estimate?, ?expect?, ?intend?, ?may?, ?might?, ?plan?, ?project?, ?result?, ?should?, ?will?, and similar expressions which do not relate solely to historical matters are intended to identify forward-looking statements. These statements are subject to risks, uncertainties, and assumptions and are not guarantees of future performance, which may be affected by known and unknown risks, trends, uncertainties, and factors that are beyond our control, including risks related to our ability to meet our estimated forecasts related to stabilized cap rates and those risk factors contained in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2009 and our other public filings. Should one or more of these risks or uncertainties materialize, or should underlying assumptions prove incorrect, actual results may vary materially from those anticipated, estimated, or projected. We expressly disclaim any responsibility to update our forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events, or otherwise.

description.hltext_display: Cold front spares fish
description.content:
FLORIDA KEYS -- Local fish populations weathered the heavy cold front that passed over the Keys last week.
"The cold wasn't long enough to cause a die-off like there was last year," Everglades National Park spokeswoman Linda Friar said. "It is part of a natural cycle that we have these cold fronts and the fish tend to weather it as long as it doesn't last too long."
Nighttime lows plunged into the 40s during the first half of last week and daytime highs last Tuesday stayed in the mid-50s. In Key West the low temperature of 46 on Dec. 15 smashed a 135-year record by six degrees.
The wintry air sent water temperature's plummeting as well -- down to as low as 49 degrees in the Whipray Basin of central Florida Bay on Dec. 15.
The conditions brought back memories of the prolonged cold front that hammered South Florida last January, when 10 days of chill left an untold number of fish and even mammal carcasses sprinkling shorelines and the waters of both the Atlantic Ocean and Florida Bay.
Everything from manatee, to valued gamefish like tarpon and bonefish, to baitfish like mullet and pilchards, succumbed to the cold.
The widespread mortalities led to additional regulations on tarpon and bonefish last winter. But it was snook that fared especially badly, particularly within Florida Bay.
A Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission study released in August showed that during the first half of this year the average number of snook caught per trip in Everglades National Park was less than a third of what it was last year. The die-off led state wildlife officials to shut down the snook fishery for all but catch-and-release through September of next year.
That cold front, however, lasted much longer than last week's, and also longer than a slightly more modest front that settled over South Florida a week earlier. It also sent water temperatures much lower. A reading of 40.5 degrees was recorded in Whipray Basin on Jan. 11 of this year, and water temperatures barely eclipsed 50 degrees over a nine day period.
By contrast, after bottoming out last Wednesday, the temperature in Whipray Basin climbed back into the 60s within three days.
As with Everglades National Park waters, the FWC says last week's cold wasn't enough to trigger a die-off.
"There were no Monroe County fish kills," spokeswoman Carli Segelson said.
The Park Service, however, was hopeful that the cold took a toll on invasive fish species in freshwater regions north of Florida Bay.
Scientists observed fish of several species to be dead or in the process of dying last week, Friar said, among them Mayan cichlid, jaguar guapote, spotfin spiney eel, walking catfish, pike killifish and black acara, all of which are not adapted to the cold because they come from tropical regions.
"The extent of the mortality of these species and what other species were impacted is still unknown," Friar said.
Exotic species are unwelcome visitors to the South Florida and the park because they prey on native species that haven't adapted the tools to defend themselves against the new predators.

description.hltext_display: Prep girls basketball roundup — Jones, Hunt power Prosser past Selah
description.content:
PROSSER, Wash. — Tamara Jones and Tayshia Hunt combined for 38 points on 14-for-21 shooting to lead unbeaten Prosser to a 66-40 victory over Selah in CWAC girls basketball Tuesday night.
Jones collected 21 points, hitting a pair of 3-pointers, seven rebounds and three steals, and Hunt counted for 17 points to push the Mustangs to 5-0 in conference and 7-0 for the season.
Helen Petersen contributed six assists and six steals for Prosser, which held Selah to 29-percent shooting. At Wapato, Sammi Jo Blodgett hit for a season-high 22 points and had five steals, and teammate Charlie Fiander grabbed six rebounds for the Wolves (3-1, 5-1), who held Quincy to 11 points in the opening half.
TOPPENISH 49, OTHELLO 34: At Toppenish, junior Osiris Rodriguez broke loose for 20 points while helping the Wildcats improve to 3-2 in league and 4-3 overall.
Freshman Kaleena Zick popped in 12 points for Top-Hi, which pulled away with an 18-4 burst in the second period. EAST VALLEY 47, GRANDVIEW 30: At East Valley, Yasi Mohsenian’s 18 points and eight rebounds sparked the Red Devils (4-1, 5-1), who held Grandview to single digits in three quarters.
Mikaela Zimmer pulled down 11 rebounds for EV.
Marissa Cabellero paced Grandview with 18 points.
ELLENSBURG 48, EPHRATA 39: At Ephrata, Shannon Bland’s 11 points and six rebounds helped the Bulldogs (1-3, 2-4) earn their first conference win.
CENTRAL WASHINGTON 2B
WHITE SWAN 62, WARDEN 33: At Warden, Sophia Perez put together 16 points and seven steals and Kassie Espindola had 15 points, eight steals and seven rebounds as the Cougars improved to 2-0 in league and 5-1 overall.
NON-LEAGUE
DAVIS 68, SUNNYSIDE 45: At Sunnyside, Taryn Cobane scored 13 of her season-high 23 points in the first half to help the Pirates open a 31-18 lead at the break.
Alexis Perez popped in 11 points and Yzarely Castro had eight steals as Davis improved to 5-1.
Melissa Amaro led Sunnyside with 11 points and two 3-pointers. LA SALLE 39, SUNNYSIDE CHRISTIAN 35: At Sunnyside Christian, Lauren DeGooyer and Karly Sattler scored 16 and 12 points, respectively, as the Lightning bumped its unbeaten record to 6-0.
La Salle got separation in the third period, outscoring the Knights 11-4. NACHES VALLEY 49, CASCADE 34: At Cascade, Justine Benner’s 13 points, seven rebounds and four assists led the unbeaten Rangers (7-0), who held Cascade to 10 points in the middle quarters. GRANGER 54, CASHMERE 45: At Cashmere, Lynndel Wapsheli scored nine of her 13 points in the fourth quarter, which the Spartans dominated 23-9.
Italia Mengarelli led all scorers for Granger (5-1) with 19 points. CLE ELUM 42, BURBANK 41: At Cle Elum, Haley Bator’s shot from beyond midcourt with three seconds left allowed the Warriors to level their season record at 4-4.
Bator finished with 15 points and 10 rebounds, and teammate Sara Ferguson grabbed seven rebounds. RIVER VIEW 50, HIGHLAND 24: At River View, senior Kassie Hampton scored 14 points to lead the Scotties. KITTITAS 65, ROYAL 22: At Royal, Shae Larsen led the Coyotes with 11 points, and teammates Dakota Adams and Kayvonne Vaver each scored nine points for Kittitas (2-2) as they beat Royal in a non-league game. DUFUR 70, YAKAMA TRIBAL 22: At Dufur, Ore., Shaarnute Azure scored 10 points with two 3-pointers, four steals and three rebounds for the Eagles.

description.hltext_display: N.Y. sues Ernst & Young in Lehman Brothers probe
description.content:
NEW YORK New York's attorney general is suing accounting giant Ernst & Young, accusing it of helping defunct investment bank Lehman Brothers hide billions of dollars in debt from investors even as it teetered on the brink of financial collapse. The civil lawsuit, filed by Attorney General Andrew Cuomo on Tuesday, days before he's due to be sworn in as the state's governor, marks the first government legal action stemming from the collapse of Lehman Brothers, one of the first milestones of Wall Street's 2008 meltdown.
It targets a practice known as "Repo 105," in which the lawsuit states Lehman Brothers made temporary overseas sales of securities, often lasting only days, and then used the money to pay off debts ahead of key quarterly reports to investors.
The system allowed the company to hold on to the inventory required by its customers while concealing debts from nervous investors, who otherwise might have sold off their shares.
The lawsuit claims that, as auditor, Ernst & Young signed off on the practice with full understanding that it was being used to deceive investors. From the launch of "Repo 105" in 2001 until the Lehman Brothers bankruptcy in 2008, Ernst & Young was paid more than $150 million for its auditing and accounting work for Lehman Brothers.
Defendants fight back
Ernst & Young said in a statement that it would defend itself in court and called the lawsuit "a significant expansion of the Martin Act" used to prosecute the case.
"There is no factual or legal basis for a claim to be brought against an auditor in this context where the accounting for the underlying transaction is in accordance with the Generally Accepted Accounting Principles," the statement said. "Lehman's audited financial statements clearly portrayed Lehman as a highly leveraged entity operating in a risky and volatile industry."
The lawsuit claims the accounting firm betrayed the public's trust.
"At a time when it was critical for investors to make informed decisions as to whether to keep or buy Lehman stock, E&Y assisted Lehman in defrauding the public," the lawsuit claims. "Lehman had no legitimate business reason to enter into such transactions, and could have obtained sufficient financing through less costly means."
Even though Lehman Brothers was legally obligated to buy back the "Repo 105" securities within a brief time, the company reported the transactions as sales rather than loans, the lawsuit claims. As much as
$50 billion in Lehman assets were shuffled in the transactions, the lawsuit states.
Such massaging of the numbers is commonplace, but usually firms explain their practices in footnotes on quarterly reports, said Arthur Bowman, who publishes the accounting industry newsletter Bowman's Accounting Report. To his knowledge, this is the first time the government has gone after an accounting firm for its part in the Wall Street debacle, Bowman said.
The lawsuit is seeking unspecified restitution and damages, and it also asks that Ernst & Young give more than $150 million in Lehman Brothers fees earned since 2001 to New York state.

event_or_fact.property: To his knowledge, this is the first time the government has gone after an accounting firm for its part in the Wall Street debacle

description.hltext_display: Flygplatsernas galna vndning - blir teleoperatrer
description.content:
Fakta
Mobilt bredband styr Arlandas wi-fi-priser
I dag kostar det 49 kr/tim att koppla upp sig i Swedavias wi-fi-nät på Arlanda. Det tredje lägsta priset bland flygplatser i Europa. Men jag tror inte vi kommer att ligga kvar på de priserna. Avgifterna styrs av priset på mobilt 3g-bredband och det är bara att se sig omkring hur de rasar just nu, säger Jan Blom. Många flygresenärer efterfrågar gratis wi-fi, enligt Jan Blom. Men det är bara flygplatserna i Bryssel och Helsingfors som har gratis wi-fi och då handlar det inte om en premiumtjänst som den vi har. Vi måste hitta nya intäktsslag för att driva vår flygplatsverksamhet. Det går inte bara att ta ut avgifter av resenärer och flygbolag. Vi måste säkerställa fler intäkter, säger Jan Blom, chef för Swedavias nystartade telekomsatsning Airport Telecom. Swedavia ansvarar för drift och utveckling av 13 svenska flygplatser. Nu har det statliga bolaget siktet inställt på att dra in 50 miljoner kronor på telekom inom ett par år. En stor del av pengarna ska komma från en stor utbyggnad av Arlanda som är på gång. Flera stora kontorsfastigheter planeras i anslutning till Sky City. I dag jobbar 16 000 personer på Arlanda, utöver Swedavias egen personal. Men 2018-2020 kommer 60 000 personer att ha sin arbetsplats på flygplatsområdet, enligt Jan Blom. Swedavia räknar med att dra in pengar på it-infrastruktur och kommunikationstjänster till de företag som etablerar sig på flygplatsen. Vi har teleoperatörsstatus och kommer att stå för fibertjänster, wi-fi-tjänster och telefoni, men även erbjuda transmissionstjänster i vårt nät som förbinder flygplatserna, säger Jan Blom. Myndigheten har monopol på att gräva ner egen nätinfrastruktur på Arlanda, som sedan andra operatörer får hyra plats i. Man kan inte gräva hur som helst ute på flygplatsen. Det är för att säkerställa flygplatsdriften, säger Jan Blom. Swedavia står också för den enda infrastrukturen för publik wi-fi på flygplatserna. Flygplatser är skyddsområden där användningen av radiobaserade nät är reglerad. Vi följer den lagstiftning som finns. Det är inga konstigheter, det är för att skydda flygfarten. Nu vid årskiftet öppnar Swedavia nya, mer utvecklade wi-fi-tjänster på sina samtliga tio flygplatser. Det nya är att vi kan roama med teleoperatörer och internationella wi-fi-operatörer, exempelvis The Cloud som har ett virtuellt nät i vårt wlan, säger Jan Blom. Tidigare hade även Teliasonera en egen wi-fi-infrastruktur på Arlanda för sin tjänst Homerun. Men nätet fick avvecklas för drygt två år sedan efter uppmärksammade konflikter med dåvarande Luftfartsverket. Men Jan Blom kallar det hela "gammalt groll" som är historia nu. Nu gäller det att kroka arm istället. Det nya wi-fi-plattformen gör att vi erbjuda Telia Homerun att roama i vårt nät. Vi hoppas att dom finns med här inom kort. Teliasonera bekräftar för CS att de för diskussioner med Swedavia. Trots att 3g-näten har hög kapacitet på Arlanda och mobiloperatörerna kör igång sina första 4g-tjänster på Arlanda i mars, anser Jan Blom att det finns en framtid för wi-fi-tjänsten. 3g-accessen kan ofta bli lite bristfällig och långsam på tätbefolkade flygplatser. Vi ger användarna 100 megabit så att man kan köra så det ryker.

description.hltext_display: Prep boys basketball roundup — Luckett leads Davis past Grizzlies
description.content:

Markus McClurkin had 13 points, Amaris Carter 12 and Jackson Marquis 11 for the Pirates (1-0 CBBN, 6-0 overall).
Israel Manzo had a game-high 26 points for the Grizzlies (0-2, 2-5).
Luckett grabbed 11 rebounds for Davis. Manzo grabbed six boards and dealt three assists for Sunnyside.
McClurkin and Marquis scored six points each for the Pirates in the fourth quarter. WAPATO 76, QUINCY 60: At Wapato, Jacoby Howe scored 32 points as the Wolves stayed unbeaten going into tonight’s matchup with Ellensburg.
Howe added six rebounds and four assists for Wapato, and connected on four 3-pointers.
Mario Martinez led Quincy with 17 points. ELLENSBURG 69, EPHRATA 42: At Ephrata, Joe Montano scored all 20 of his points in the first half on 9-for-11 shooting as the Bulldogs rolled to set up tonight’s matchup of unbeatens against Wapato.
Reese Ravet connected on 5-pointers en route to 17 points for Ellensburg (6-0 overall, 4-0 ), and Corey Dunlop dished out 10 assists to go along with five points.
Tanner Williams led the Tigers with 13 points. GRANDVIEW 66, EAST VALLEY 57: At East Valley, Daniel Nielsen scored 22 points and Christian Schrank added 19 for the undefeated Greyhounds.
Jonathan Janis led all scorers with 23 points and Brandon Ward added 10 points and seven rebounds for the Red Devils. SELAH 69, PROSSER 56: At Prosser, Drew Dyer scored 17 of his 19 points in the second half and hauled down nine rebounds for the Vikings (3-1, 3-3), who scored 47 points in the second half.
Brady Hutchins made three of Selah’s seven 3-pointers and collected eight assists.

Davis Flores led the Panthers with 13 points. ROYAL 67, KITTITAS 52: At Royal, Cameron Taylor turned in a double-double of 14 points and 16 rebounds for the Coyotes (1-3), and teammate Laker Brooks popped in 13 points.
SUNNYSIDE CHRISTIAN 76, LA SALLE 40: At Sunnyside Christian, Steven Broersma and Trevor Wagenaar combined for 41 points as the Knights improved to 5-2.
Broersma paced all scorers with 22 points for SC, which held La Salle to 11 points in the first half. BURBANK 65, CLE ELUM 36: At Cle Elum, Tyler Kretschman scored 13 points and Matt Wallace grabbed eight rebounds to lead the Warriors. DUFUR 76, YAKAMA TRIBAL 53: At Dufur, Ore., Joe Scabbyrobe scored 15 points and Jerret Wong added 12 for the Eagles.
