description.hltext_display: How A Charlie Brown Christmas became a holiday tradition
description.content:
Posted:
© Warner Home Video
Photo Galleries from TVGuide
Entertainment News from TV Guide More>>
Christmas time is here... and so is the 45th anniversary of A Charlie Brown Christmas. Filled with humor, heart and a universal message of goodwill toward men, the tale of Chuck's search for the meaning of Christmas, Snoopy's prize-winning decorations and the saddest little tree ever never fails to make the season bright. So we rang up executive producer Lee Mendelson to talk about the special's lasting legacy, how it came to be, and Mariah Carey's take on its iconic theme as performed on her "Merry Christmas to You" special earlier this month.
TV Guide Magazine: So congratulations and thank you for what is easily one of TV's greatest holiday specials.
Mendelson: Well, thank you! TV Guide Magazine was the most instrumental thing in the success of A Charlie Brown Christmas, did you know that? The week before it aired, they did a 2-page color spread. They recreated a Charlie Brown comic strip, but put in it the plot of the special. It was maybe the last week in November or the first week of December in 1965. And of course, we've been on your cover several times. TV Guide Magazine has been very good to us.
TV Guide Magazine: And your relationship with Charles M. Schulz all started from a love of baseball?
Mendelson: Right. I had done a Willie Mays special that had aired on NBC and was reading a Charlie Brown strip where he had lost 800 games in a row. The idea popped into my head that I had done the best ballplayer ever, why not do the world's worst? So I called Schulz -- he was listed in the phone book his whole life -- and he said come on up, let's talk. He had seen the Willie Mays show and idolized him. That's how the whole thing began.
TV Guide Magazine: Where did you guys come up with the plot?
Mendelson: He had done comic strips at Christmastime, of course, and would show the strain little kids come under doing Christmas pageants. So maybe 10 lines came out of the comics, the rest was original.
TV Guide Magazine: And now, Mariah Carey is covering "Christmas Time is Here" on her special.
Mendelson: In a very breath manner! [Laughs]
TV Guide Magazine: Can you believe that the song has become so iconic?
Mendelson: We had finished the show and there was just this instrumental... we had a few weeks before it aired and I said if we could get someone to write some words, we could have someone sing the song and have a bigger opening moment to the special. I called around town to different lyricists and so forth, but everyone was busy. I don't know what possessed me, but there was an envelope on my kitchen table and I put dots and dashes down for the long notes and short notes. It was like playing Hangman. I wish I had that envelope still! I wrote the song in 10 minutes or so. It was like a poem, it just came to me. And I gave it to [composer] Vince Guaraldi, who got a bunch of kids from a church choir to record it. And now it's been covered by, oh I don't know, maybe 100 different artists. Tony Bennett. Johnny Mathis sang it on Oprah. It's like a surreal dream that goes on and on.
TV Guide Magazine: What do you think of Mariah's version?
Mendelson: We're thrilled. She is one of my all-time favorite singers. And I think, though it's been covered so many times before, that this is the first time it will be sung on a primetime special.
TV Guide Magazine: Very cool. Now, is it true that Schulz didn't actually like A Charlie Brown Christmas?
Mendelson: Oh no! He did like it. When we finished it, [fellow exec producer] Bill Melendez and I thought it might be too slow. That is one of the reasons I wanted the song to give it a little oomph at the top. But no, Bill and I didn't think it worked, CBS didn't think it worked, but he liked it and was confident from day one.
TV Guide Magazine: ABC re-aired the special on Thursday the 16th. Do you have a tradition for watching it?
Mendelson: Oh sure, the whole family gets together. Of course, back then, it was four of us. Now there's 12 of us. [Laughs] We all watch it together. Also, when it first aired, there were only three networks. We got a 49-share! Think about that. Half the country tuned in. Today, if we get a 10-share, we're thrilled.
TV Guide Magazine: Is there anything you would want to change about the special today?
Mendelson: Goodness, no. This was a very surreal once-in-a-lifetime thing where everything came together. The music, the acting, the theme... I can't think of a thing we'd change.
View original How A Charlie Brown Christmas Became a Holiday Tradition at TVGuide.com

description.hltext_display: Laprida llega con aire suficiente para mantener hoy la categoría
description.content:
RECIBE A ROCA DESDE LAS 18 POR LA REVANCHA CORRESPONDIENTE A LA PROMOCION DE LA LIGA OFICIAL DE COMODORO RIVADAVIA
En el partido de ida, el conjunto del “Far West” ganó 1-0. Por pertenecer a una división superior, respecto de los roquenses, le alcanza hasta con una derrota por un gol de diferencia para permanecer en la A.
Laprida del Oeste recibirá hoy en su cancha a General Roca, por la revancha correspondiente a la temporada 2010 de la Liga de Fútbol de Comodoro Rivadavia. El partido comenzará a las 18 y será arbitrado por Jaime Melián.
El gol convertido por Orlando Chazampi a los 32 minutos del segundo tiempo, en el encuentro de ida jugado en Rada Tilly, fue suficiente para que hoy el cuadro del “Far West” llegue con firmes posibilidades de mantener la categoría en la A.
Al arranque de la reválida, Laprida y Roca arribaban con las mismas posibilidades, más allá de la ventaja deportiva. Y le costó al elenco de Eduardo Rivas doblegar a un rival difícil, que el último domingo tuvo chances como para abrir el marcador en la villa balnearia, y hasta para empatar sobre el final.
La victoria quedó para Laprida con lo justo, pero esa diferencia de un tanto es crucial en las promociones, por lo que el “Albirrojo” hoy deberá hacer el doble de esfuerzo y ganar por dos goles de diferencia para ascender.
Todavía nada está dicho, pero el equipo del “Far West” llega más entero anímicamente y ahora quiere ratificar en su casa que está para quedarse en la A.
La otra revancha por la reválida, entre Oeste Juniors y Diadema, se jugará este domingo en cancha de Unión San Martín Azcuénaga, donde también se disputó el compromiso de ida que terminó igualado sin goles.

description.hltext_display: Alchemy Solutions Finishes 2010 with Strong Profit Growth in Legacy Modernization, Migration Market
description.content:
Marking its second year as an independent software company, Alchemy Solutions today cited a significant increase in activity in the legacy modernization and migration market as one of the key drivers for its continuing, unbridled growth. The provider of legacy modernization solutions for the Microsoft .NET Framework spun-off from Fujitsu in December 2008, and finishes 2010 with accelerating growth in both its customer and partner communities.
Alchemy Solutions product line includes the NEO family of tools; the company is also the U.S. distributor of the Fujitsu NetCOBOL line of highly reliable COBOL compilers. Ever aware of the long-term importance of COBOL-based systems in the enterprise software market, customers have quickly recognized that Alchemy continues to deliver value by reducing the total cost of ownership while exploiting the capabilities of Visual Studio and the .NET Framework.
In 2009, the first year after its formation from the Legacy Modernization group at Fujitsu, Alchemy Solutions tripled the company?s size, and launched a major new partnership program. In 2010, Alchemy Solutions achieved a 20 percent increase in sales over 2009, and increased its investment in talent in order to cope with unprecedented inquiries and orders from new and existing customers. The company?s additions to its management team include Don McCormick, who joined the company as vice president of sales, to support the ever-growing channel. With more than 24 years of sales and business development experience in the technology sector, McCormick came to Alchemy Solutions from ATERAS, which is an active member of the Alchemy Solutions channel partner program.
Among its 2010 milestones, Alchemy Solutions:
Received a Sales Momentum Award from Microsoft, recognizing the company?s accomplishments in helping organizations save money and increase agility by modernizing mainframe applications and data. Collaborated with Microsoft and Idea Integration in hosting an executive IT summit that explored migrating mainframe applications to more efficient platforms. Held at the Georgia Aquarium in Atlanta, the summit featured a presentation by Gartner Research Vice President Dale Vecchio, on the state of the mainframe modernization market. Partnered with Microsoft and BizLogica on a mainframe modernizing seminar for European enterprises, helping then consider whether to migrate to more cost-effective platforms. Massimo Pezzini, vice president and distinguished analyst in Gartner Research, addressed the workshop, which was held in Milan, to discuss technology and business trends that are accelerating the shifting of workloads. Expanded and solidified relationships with members of its partner program, including ExperSolve, Inc., a leader in legacy migration services; and added its first partner in Finland, the Finnish Support Center, Ltd. (FSC), a migration services company based in Helsinki. description.hltext_display: Huracán y Jorge Newbery jugarán el 23 de febrero
description.content:
ES EL UNICO PARTIDO QUE RESTA JUGARSE POR EL CLAUSURA 2010 DE LA “A" DE COMODORO RIVADAVIA Y SE DISPUTARA EN EL ANIVERSARIO DE LA CIUDAD
El Comité Ejecutivo de la Liga reprogramó el clásico, donde no estará en juego más que el honor, ya que el “Globo” es el campeón del último certamen de este año.
Una nueva reprogramación sufrió el clásico del fútbol de Comodoro Rivadavia. El Comité Ejecutivo de la Liga determinó anteanoche que Huracán y Jorge Newbery jueguen el miércoles 23 de febrero de 2011, el día del cumpleaños de la capital del petróleo.
La última postergación del encuentro, correspondiente a la 17ª y anteúltima fecha del torneo Clausura de la A, se debió a que la dirigencia de Jorge Newbery, argumentando que sus jugadores estaban licenciados, envió una nota a la Liga donde anunciaba que no iba a poder presentar su primer equipo para el sábado pasado, cuando tenía que disputarse el compromiso de acuerdo a la anterior reprogramación.
A todo esto, la comisión directiva de Huracán ya se encontraba vendiendo los boletos y se estaba organizando el operativo de seguridad, por lo que la sede madre del fútbol local decidió volver a programar el partido, en vez de otorgarle los puntos al “Globo” y multar a Newbery, según afirmaron desde la Liga de Fútbol.
Ahora habrá que esperar dos meses más, para un clásico donde no estará en juego más que el honor, teniendo en cuenta que Huracán se consagró campeón del Clausura anticipadamente. El encuentro se desarrollará en el estadio César Muñoz del barrio Industrial, sin público visitante.

description.hltext_display: ArcelorMittal bid goes before Canadian regulators
Japans Exporte im November gestiegen
description.content:
Die japanischen Ausfuhren sind im November gestiegen. Die Exporte erhöhten sich im Vergleich zum Vorjahresmonat um 9,1 Prozent auf 5,4 Billionen Yen (49 Milliarden Euro). Damit stiegen die Ausfuhren im nunmehr zwölften Monat in Folge. Die Importe erhöhten sich um 14,2 Prozent auf 5,3 Billionen Yen. Als Folge sank Japans Handelsbilanzüberschuss um 55,4 Prozent auf 162,8 Milliarden Yen.

description.hltext_display: Bolívar se despidió del Mundial de Clubes con un cuarto puesto
description.content:
Bolívar, tetracampeón argentino, no sostuvo el ritmo inicial, fue incapaz de detener el avance del rival y terminó cayendo con el Paykán, de Irán, por 3 a 2, en el partido por el tercer puesto del Mundial de clubes de vóleibol masculino, que se disputó en la ciudad de Doha, Qatar.
De esta forma, el equipo dirigido por Javier Weber se clasificó en la cuarta colocación y recibió una recompensa de 90 mil dólares por su participación.
Los parciales del encuentro jugado a primera hora de ayer en el estadio Al Gharafa de la capital qatarí fueron los siguientes: Bolívar 25-23, 25-23, 23-25, 20-25 y 13-15.
La medalla dorada quedó en poder del Trentino de Italia, que en el partido decisivo le ganó a Skra Belchatow de Polonia por 3-1, con parciales de 25-22, 25-19, 20-25 y 25-16, en una hora y 45 minutos de juego.
El conjunto bonaerense desplegó lo mejor de su juego en los dos primeros sets: los aportes de Federico Pereyra (25 puntos) fueron suficiente para que los de Weber se quedaran con ambos segmentos, por un marcador de 25-23, en forma apretada pero convincente.
Inclusive, Bolívar estuvo a punto de cerrar el partido a su favor en el tercer segmento, cuando tomó una distancia de 12-6, que parecía definitiva.
Sin embargo, el conjunto iraní se recuperó a tiempo y con la labor de Bazargarde (18 tantos) empezó a levantar una producción que parecía destinada al fracaso.
De esta forma, Paykán estableció primero una inimaginable igualdad en 15 tantos y luego pasó a comandar la pizarra por 2 (21-19).
Sobre el final, un fallo polémico de los árbitros que cantó mala una pelota de Pereyra que había picado dentro de la cancha le posibilitó a los iraníes adueñarse del parcial por 25-23.
A partir de esa instancia, el equipo asiático tomó mayor confianza y asomó como el dominador. Bolívar empezó a mostrar errores de concentración y el cuarto set correspondió al Paykán, por 25-20.
En el quinto y definitivo set, el conjunto iraní tuvo un mejor cierre y se quedó con la medalla de bronce, al imponerse finalmente por 15-13.
“Tuvimos la chance de ganarlo (el partido) pero la desperdiciamos y el nivel del principio no volvió en una segunda oportunidad. Probablemente, los jugadores hayan sentido que tenían el partido ganado y se relajaron”, admitió Weber, con decepción.
Por su lado, el capitán Gabriel Arroyo habló de “una gran frustración” por el encuentro que “se nos escapó de una manera increíble”.
En cambio, el técnico iraní Paiban Akbari remarcó que el de ayer “es un día histórico no sólo para la familia de vóleibol sino también para toda la comunidad deportiva de Irán. Clasificarnos en la tercera posición en un campeonato de estas características no es poco”, resumió.

description.hltext_display: Wriezen: 7.000 Entenküken in Wriezen verbrannt
description.author: MAZ
description.content:
In einer Geflügelmastanlage in Wriezen (Märkisch-Oderland) sind am Mittwochmorgen 7.000 Entenküken verbrannt. Die Tiere waren erst vor drei Tagen geschlüpft, wie die Polizei in Frankfurt (Oder) mitteilte. Brandursache war vermutlich ein technischer Defekt.
Der Sachschaden beträgt etwa 20.000 Euro. Menschen wurden nicht verletzt.

description.hltext_display: Survivor's Rob and Amber welcome baby girl
description.content:
Photo Galleries from TVGuide
Entertainment News from TV Guide More>>
It's another girl for Survivor couple Rob and Amber Mariano.
Carina Rose Mariano was born Dec. 10 -- almost in the back of the couple's car.
"By the time we got to the car, [contractions] were a minute apart, and we live 40 minutes from the hospital. We got there at 2:15 a.m. and she had the baby at 2:25 a.m. There was no time for an IV, no time for an epidural. It was amazing what she did," Mariano said at the Survivor: Nicaragua live reunion show Sunday.
Rob and Amber Rob fell in love when they competed on the Survivor: All-Stars season in 2004. During that live finale, in which Amber was announced as the winner and Rob the runner-up, the two became engaged. In 2005, CBS aired a two-hour special detailing their wedding.
Carina joins 17-month-old big sister Lucia Rose.
View original Survivor's Rob and Amber Welcome Baby Girl at TVGuide.com
Other Links From TVGuide.com

description.hltext_display: Name new elementary school after Fulmore
description.content:
I want to thank Cameron S. Falkener ("New local school should be named for Fulmore," Dec. 16) for suggesting the new elementary school be named after Dr. Julius Fulmore. I met Dr. Fulmore at my very first school orientation in 1972 at Hampton Elementary.
I was with my mother and was scared to death. Dr. Fulmore took the time to meet with us and comfort me in my obvious wide-eyed fear.
He was gentle and caring. I never forgot the moment and when I read that the school board was looking for nominations for the name of the school, Dr. Fulmore immediately came to mind.
There’s not a more deserving public school figure in the last 30 years here than Dr. Fulmore.
Please reprint the way in which the public can voice their nominations. I hope anyone who has come in contact with him will voice their opinion.
Thank you, Dr. Fulmore, for giving me the courage to get through those first days of school at Hampton. You will never be forgotten.

description.hltext_display: Pablo Hermo y Fabián Sambueza tienen todo arreglado con Huracán
description.content:
Ayer se oficializaron las negociaciones. El zaguero central de 20 años se formó en Arsenal de Sarandí. El enganche viene de jugar en Independiente de Neuquén.
Fabián Sambueza tratando de dominar con la camiseta de Independiente de Neuquén.
Desde Capital Federal, el presidente de Huracán, Gustavo Córdoba, le confirmó ayer a Diario Patagónico que los primeros dos jugadores que pretendía la dirigencia para afrontar la segunda rueda del torneo Argentino B 2010-2011, ya están confirmados como refuerzos.
Se trata del volante de creación Fabián Sambueza, de 22 años y con un último paso por Independiente de Neuquén, y del zaguero central Pablo Hermo, proveniente de Arsenal de Sarandí. Hermo tiene 20 años, nació el 2 de agosto de 1990 en Avellaneda y mide 1,90. Se destaca por su juego aéreo y por el buen control de pelota.
Las negociaciones ya venían avanzadas y era casi un hecho que ambos futbolistas recalarían en el “Globo” comodorense, pero restaba la definición de algunos detalles que fueron cerrados ayer.
Mientras tanto, se sigue en busca de un delantero y un volante central, teniendo en cuenta que se dio de baja a Matías Willhuber y Alexis Cabrera, quienes no colmaron las expectativas.
El plantel dirigido por Víctor Doria comenzará la pretemporada el 5 de enero en Comodoro Rivadavia, y a mediados de ese mes se trasladará a Buenos Aires, donde culminará su preparación pensando en levantar cabeza en la segunda rueda del Argentino B.
Córdoba se encuentra en Capital Federal junto a su vicepresidente, Lucio Coñocar. Ambos, además de estar a la cabeza de las negociaciones por refuerzos, buscan en Buenos Aires avanzar en cuanto a cuestiones que tienen que ver con las obras institucionales.
En ese sentido, la dirigencia huracanense ya adquirió los cuatro molinetes que serán instalados en los ingresos al estadio César Muñoz -tres en el portón de entrada a la popular y uno en el ingreso a las plateas-. Además, se está evaluando ofertas para el césped sintético que se pretende instalar en la cancha auxiliar.

description.hltext_display: 100 films in five years
description.content:
YORK ? With the recent showing of "Babine" on Dec. 19, the York Public Library Film Group has presented 100 films over five years of Sunday afternoons and evenings. The volunteer group began less formally showing occasional movies, a few in the summer and a few in the winter. Gradually, as interest and audiences grew, the Film Group arrived at its present formula, weekly in the summer and bi-weekly in the off-season, as well as a family fun film series throughout the year. All movies are free and open to the public.
In 2009, using money from donations, the library installed surround sound in the Community Meeting Room where films are shown.
"That was a big upgrade," says Bill Lord, chairperson of the Film Group and Library Trustee. "There's nothing like really hearing the soundtrack of today's motion pictures, especially with the great advancements in audio technology and sound effects."
The next step will be a wide screen and high-definition projector to take advantage of new video technology, and fundraising is planned for 2011.
"The point," says Lord, "is to bring people in our community together. Whether it's to enjoy watching a movie or working together on a fundraising event like the Library Book Sale, our Library is a focal point of our town. We've had close to 3,000 people come see a movie at the library."
Libraries expanded during the Depression era of the 1930s as a low-cost cultural hub. "It was not just about books," says Neil Novello, Film Group member. "Libraries had lectures and cultural programs. Today, the York Public Library continues that tradition. Movies are over a hundred years old and are universally accepted as an art form."

description.hltext_display: 黑客瞄准网购 金山网络策动多重破解方案
description.author: dlgboy
description.content:
黑客已经瞄准井喷式增长的网络购物市场，并且已经形成了一条完整的黑客产业链条——日前，由金山网络发布的《2010年中国网络购物安全报告》显示，2010年，随着网络购物的蓬勃发展，针对网络购物的安全威胁形式十分严峻：有近28%的互联网用户遭遇过安全攻击，带来直接经济损失将突破150亿元，人均经济损失约150元。
报告显示，和以前的病毒、木马等通过控制“肉鸡”电脑或者盗取游戏、QQ账号密码等信息，并通过交易获取经济利益的方式不同，不法分子对爆发性成长的网络购物的利用和攻击，能够更直接的获取更多的经济利益。数据显示，目前影响我国消费者网络购物的安全威胁主要包括三大类：钓鱼网站、新型交易劫持木马、传统盗号木马。其中，网络购物用户遭遇的所有安全威胁中有72.4%是以钓鱼网站进行的；而占第二位的是新型交易劫持木马，占所有威胁的16.8%，是2010年增长最快的安全威胁，也是让网络购物用户最防不胜防的攻击手段；最后，盗取网络购物账号或者网银账号的木马占威胁总数的8.7%。
针对最新的网购安全威胁，金山网络从技术创新和进步，以及和其他厂商联合等方式，推出了对应的技术及行业安全解决方案，包括：
技术层面解决方案
1、网址云安全智能反钓鱼
对于网络钓鱼欺诈的技术查杀，金山网络安全实验室经过长期研究，分析了网络钓鱼目前最常用手段，找到了对付网络钓鱼欺诈的最佳解决方案：
这个方案的核心技术在于可以通过服务端的自动收集和自动识别，来有效拦截有可能被网民访问到的网络钓鱼网站。目前每天阻止网民访问钓鱼网站的次数已超过40万次。同时有效修复因不慎访问钓鱼网站导致的安全问题，通过金山毒霸2011组合防御可有效拦截各类“钓鱼”欺诈网址！
2、网购木马专杀——针对性拦截更有效
金山全系列安全产品均集成了下载保护功能，当用户通过IM工具、下载工具传播程序时，会自动对要传播的文件进行安全检查，及时收集和识别其中的病毒木马，当一个网址或文件被判定为恶意欺骗下载链接或病毒文件时，该恶意网址和文件的传播会立即被千万级的用户网络所阻止。
针对数字大盗这样典型的交易劫持木马，金山毒霸还提供了特别的解决方案——当检测到交易页面被跳转、通过淘宝旺旺或QQ传输了一个敏感的程序文件、网购用户在打开某个程序文件后有特别的程序释放等等，这些关键环节，金山毒霸会及时报警，最大限度避免网民受数字大盗这种木马加钓鱼网址的双重攻击而遭受损失。此项功能将在即将发布的金山毒霸SP5最新版中全面集成。
行业解决方案——互联网厂商联合对抗网络欺诈
1.安全厂商与网购厂商、浏览器厂商的大力合作
2009年12月9日，金山网络联手傲游浏览器以及电子商务平台淘宝网、支付宝，共同推出国内首个网购安全平台。他们将共同联手在反钓鱼网站、主动防御网页挂马、网络购物安全等方面达成战略联盟，通过凝聚四方多项安全技术，充分满足多层次用户的需求。此举开创了互联网安全厂商为电子商务平台提供互联网安全服务的先河，必将极大地提升电子商务在线交易的安全程度。此外，金山还将与百度、腾讯等互联网企业合作，共同解决网民在网购过程中的安全问题。
2、金山卫士开源计划——拦截钓鱼欺诈无处不在
为了让更多的互联网应用可以吸取金山网址云安全系统的成功经验，金山决定向全社会无偿公开云安全数据库，任何互联网软件只要申请成为金山开源计划成员，就可以无偿使用。
在不久的将来，我们将看到：能拦截钓鱼网址的聊天工具、邮件客户端、搜索引擎、浏览器和下载工具。金山开源计划可以让互联网变得更安全，钓鱼网站的危害将被有效遏制。

description.hltext_display: Chile lawyer seeks arrests in folk singer's death
description.content:
A Chilean government lawyer is seeking to arrest four retired army officers for the killing of renowned folk singer Victor Jara during the 1973 coup.
The Interior Ministry's Human Rights Program submitted a formal request for their detention to Judge Juan Fuentes Belmar on Tuesday, according to an official familiar with the case. The official spoke to The Associated Press on condition of anonymity to avoid influencing the magistrate's decision.
The case targets retired officers Edwin Dimter, Hugo Sanchez and Raul Jofre, and ex-prosecutor Rolando Melo, the official said.
Jara, a folk singer, theater director, communist and outspoken supporter of socialist President Salvador Allende, was detained in a stadium along with 5,000 other leftists when Gen. Augusto Pinochet took power in a military coup on Sept. 11, 1973. Pulled from the crowd, Jara was tortured and shot to death by the military as a message to the rest.
The killing turned Jara into an international symbol of resistance to the Pinochet government, which lasted until 1990.
Some witnesses have accused Dimter of being a military officer long known only as "The Prince," who led torture and killings at the stadiums and is believed responsible for Jara's death.
Dimter has denied killing Jara and sued a journalist who wrote an article identifying him as "The Prince."
So far the only person to be prosecuted for Jara's killing is former conscript Jose Paredes Marquez, 56, who proclaims his innocence.
In an interview with the AP last year, Paredes said all conscripts were carrying machine guns and Jara's body would have been torn apart by such a weapon.
An autopsy from 2009 found that the folk singer died from dozens of gunshot wounds all over his body, and the singer's widow, Joan Jara, has said she had no difficulty recognizing his remains.
Tuesday's petition seeking the arrest warrants was filed by lawyer Cristian Cruz of the Human Rights Program.
Cruz and a colleague were recently laid off, effective Jan. 1, by the center-right government of Sebastian Pinera, which cited budgetary pressures.

description.hltext_display: SKorea begins routine naval drills amid tension
description.content:
A government ship sails past the South Korean Navy's floating base as the sun rises near Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Wednesday, Dec. 22, 2010. (AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)
South Korean marines stand guard as they wait their fellow soldiers to return their base after patrolling along the seashore on Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Wednesday, Dec. 22, 2010. (AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)
South Korean Marines patrol along the seashore on Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Wednesday, Dec. 22, 2010. (AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)
** ADDS AP SIGNOFF ** South Korean marines stand guard as they wait their fellow soldiers to return their base after patrolling along on Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Wednesday, Dec. 22, 2010. (AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)
South Korea has begun annual naval exercises off its east coast as tensions with North Korea remain high.
The drills beginning Wednesday and ending Saturday are on the opposite coast from the disputed sea border where North Korea shelled a front-line island a month ago.
But South Korea's military is on high alert following firing exercises from the island Monday.
A Joint Chiefs of Staff officer says navy ships will fire artillery and conduct anti-submarine exercises. The officer spoke on condition of anonymity, citing department rules.
Most of the Koreas' recent military skirmishes have taken place near the western sea frontier drawn by U.N. forces at the close of the 1950-53 Korean War. North Korea rejects the boundary.

description.hltext_display: Library staff recommends these holiday read-alouds
description.author: Kathleen Whalin
description.content:
& the YPL Staff On
One of our staff members, Julie Eneman, celebrates the start of the holiday season by putting a feather bed in front of her fireplace. She says it's the best place to curl up and read a good book. Whether you have a real or metaphorical fireplace in your home, the December holidays are perfect occasions to gather the family around the hearth and share favorite stories.
Long after the newest toy is forgotten, the thoughts of time shared with loved ones linger on. Holidays are made as much of memories as anything else, hence the appeal of memoirs like Dylan Thomas' "A Child's Christmas in Wales." As librarians, we celebrate good stories year round, but this tends to be the time of year we think back on the books we've read to children or had read to us as a child. So break out the hot chocolate, cookies, and popcorn (Julie's recommended fireside menu), take out a favorite story, and let a holiday tradition begin.
Some titles we've loved:
Sudie:
"My favorite holiday read-aloud is 'The Best Christmas Pageant Ever' by Barbara Robinson. I first read it aloud at a birthday sleepover our daughter Libby had around Christmas. Although it's a longer chapter book (80 pages), all three girls insisted that I finish the whole thing that night. The four of us laughed hysterically as the outrageous Herdman children, who have never heard the Christmas story before, take over the major parts in the Christmas pageant at their local church. And we all got lumps in our throats at the end, as the Herdmans ? and everyone else ? figured out the real meaning of the Christmas story."
Julie:
"'Auntie Claus' by Elise Primavera is a funny, colorful picture book that makes a great read-aloud during the holidays. It's the story of Sophie Claus, a spoiled but spunky girl who spends her afternoons having tea with her 'mysterioso' great-aunt, Auntie Claus. The two have opposing mottoes. Sophie believes that you can never have too many presents, while Auntie Clause believes that it is far better to give than to receive. Wondering where her great-aunt goes every Christmas, Sophie hatches a plot to find out. But what will happen when Sophie finds her little brother's name on the naughty list? Read Elise Primavera's book to find out!"
Kim:
"'The Polar Express' written and illustrated by Chris Van Allsburg came out in 1985 when my son was just 2 and quickly became a family holiday favorite. (Actually when my children were little, it was read year-round.) Between the somewhat dreamy illustrations (winner of the Caldecott medal in 1986) and the mysterious undercurrents in the story, this book has timeless appeal. If you are only familiar with the movie, you haven't really experienced the magic."
Robert:
"'Hershel and the Hanukkah Goblins' by Eric Kimmel, illustrated by Trina Schart Hyman. Hershel of Ostropol, using his resourcefulness and a few props (pickles, eggs, and a dreidel), outwits creepy hobgoblins determined to ruin yet another Hanukkah."
Kathleen:
"'A Christmas Carol' by Charles Dickens. Long before it was a York school play, Dickens' 'Christmas Carol' was a yuletide fixture. Charles Dickens himself gave public readings of his novella, recreating the characters of Ebenezer Scrooge, Tiny Tim, Bob Cratchit, and Marley's ghost. For me, Dickens' tale of a reformed miser and celebration of all the true spirit of Christmas, retains its power year after year. I read the opening line 'Marley was dead' and I'm instantly transported back to both my North Dakota childhood and Victorian London.
Michele:
"'Merry Christmas Big Hungry Bear' by Don & Audrey Wood is a wonderful story that I read to my preschool children and still enjoy reading to them now that they are in school. This is a followup to the 'The Little Mouse,' 'the Red Ripe Strawberry' and 'the Big Hungry Bear.' Little Mouse begins to worry about the safety of his presents from the Big Hungry Bear and tries to lock up his gifts. He has a change of heart when he learns that the Big Hungry Bear doesn't receive any presents. This is a sweet, funny holiday story with an emphasis on giving!"
"Golden Door": At 7 p.m. Jan. 8, the York Diversity Forum Film Series will feature this film on the immigrant experience. In this sweeping immigrant's tale (2007) from director Emanuele Crialese, Sicilian widower Salvatore Mancuso (Vincenzo Amato) leaves behind everything he knows to pursue a better life in America at the dawn of the 20th century. With his sons in tow, Mancuso survives the harrowing Atlantic crossing only to suffer more hardship and humiliation on Ellis Island. But along the way, he finds romance with a mysterious Englishwoman (Charlotte Gainsbourg). "An Education": The Winter Film Festival shows this film at 3 p.m. Sunday, Jan. 9. The film is a coming-of-age story about a teenage girl in 1960s suburban London, and how her life changes with the arrival of a playboy nearly twice her age. Oscar nominated for best picture, best actress (Carey Mulligan), and best writing/screenplay. Rated PG for mature thematic material involving sexual content, and smoking. Run time: 100 minutes. "Under the Same Moon": The York Diversity Forum Film Series continues at 7 p.m. Saturday, Jan. 15. This film follows a heart-warming story about a mother who leaves Mexico to make a home for herself and her son (Adrian Alonso). When the boy's grandmother dies, leaving him alone, he sets off on his own to find his mother (Kate del Castillo). "Al Derben Trio" and "Nice and Naughty": Concerts for a Winter Afternoon start at 3 p.m. Sunday, Jan. 16. "Al Derben Trio" plays a mix of swing era standards and songs from the Great American Songbook. The unusual combination of instruments (guitars and pedal steel) brings a unique musical flavor to this talented group. The show opens with "Nice and Naughty" whose original music speaks to all aspects of everyday life, from whimsical to poignant...;serious to silly. Accompanied by stand-up bass, guitar and pennywhistle their exquisite harmonies are the highlight of their performances. Sometimes irreverent but never rude...;they're always fun!
For children
LAPSIT: 10:30 a.m. Thursdays, stories and rhymes for ages 2 and under. PRESCHOOL STORY HOUR: 10:30 a.m. Fridays for ages 3 to 5 MUSIC IN MOTION: 10:30 a.m. on the first Tuesday. TACTILE TODDLER TIME: 10:15-10:45 a.m. every second Tuesday of the month. ART BY THE POND: 10:15-10:45 a.m. every third Tuesday of the month. SCIENCE STORY TIMES: 10:30 a.m. on the fourth Thursday of the month.

description.hltext_display: Tracy Morgan absent from 30 Rock while recovering from surgery
description.content:
© PRNewsFoto/Volkswagen of America, Inc.
Photo Galleries from TVGuide
Entertainment News from TV Guide More>>
Tracy Morgan will miss at least two episodes of 30 Rock airing in March while he recovers from surgery, TVGuide.com has confirmed.
Morgan, 42, underwent a kidney transplant around Dec. 10, according to Entertainment Weekly, which first reported the news. "Tracy is doing well and taking some much needed time to recover after the surgery," a rep for the actor said. "He is looking forward to going back to work after the holidays."
30 Rock will address Morgan's absence by saying his character had a meltdown after receiving some good news. Maybe Tracy Jordan scored that Golden Globe he was hoping for?
Morgan's co-star, Grizz Chapman, who is the national spokesperson for the Kidney Foundation, also had a kidney transplant earlier this year.
View original Tracy Morgan Absent From 30 Rock While Recovering From Surgery at TVGuide.com

description.hltext_display: China replaces top Foreign Ministry official
description.content:
China has replaced its top Foreign Ministry official amid a trend toward greater assertiveness in handling territorial disputes and participating in global organizations.
Vice Foreign Minister Zhang Zhijun took over recently as the ministry's Communist Party secretary, state media reports said Wednesday, meaning he outranks Foreign Minister Yang Jiechi. Yang was accused of being caught off guard when U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton announced at a security conference in Vietnam this year that Washington considered the peaceful resolution of South China Sea disputes as part of the American national interest.
Zhang, 57, had served almost his entire career in the party's International Liaison Department, a type of shadow Foreign Ministry focussing on contacts with foreign political parties, until he became deputy to Yang last year.
That party background may mean he has more of a say in policymaking than his predecessor, as China increasingly abandons its former low-key approach to dealing with the outside world. The country's rising economic clout amid the global economic downturn that has battered traditional powers such as the United States has emboldened Chinese leaders to demand a bigger say in global affairs such as climate change and at international organizations, including the United Nations.
China's aggressive assertion of its territorial claims in the South China and East China seas have, meanwhile, sparked a backlash from other countries in the region, drawing them closer to Washington.
The powerful People's Liberation Army is believed to be leading the calls for a tougher line in such disputes, while other cabinet officials have emphasized quietly advancing China's interests in economic, media and cultural spheres.
China's most senior diplomat, State Counselor Dai Bingguo, is seen as balancing the different arguments, although the country's opaque political system ensures that such debates almost never make it into the public arena.
Little is known about Zhang's personal style, although his party background and relative lack of experience working abroad suggest he will closely reflect the tone set by the party leadership.
Zhang's appointment was announced on official websites, including that of the party's People's Daily newspaper, but no exact date was given.
He takes over from Wang Guangya, a courtly career diplomat who was ambassador to the U.N. from 2003-2008, during which China took advantage of the U.S. preoccupation with Iraq to quietly expand its diplomatic space.

event_or_fact.property: Washington considered the peaceful resolution of South China Sea disputes as part of the American national interest.

description.hltext_display: 分析：谷歌遭遇欧盟调查 或被迫公开算法
description.content:
2010-12-22 14:14:02 来源:新浪科技 【大 中 小】 评论：0 条 收藏本文 转发至：
站长交易（http://jy.chinaz.com）友情链接交换 虚拟主机评测+IDC导航=IDC123.COM
导语：国外媒体周三发表分析文章称，欧盟委员会正在对谷歌展开反垄断调查，调查其是否滥用市场主导地位打压网络搜索竞争对手。谷歌可能会像微软一样遭遇数年的诉讼，甚至可能被迫公开其搜索算法。
以下为文章全文：
谷歌的网络搜索算法就像可口可乐的配方一样，是该公司的最高机密。但在目前，该公司却面临欧盟委员会的反垄断调查，目的是确认其是否滥用市场主导地位压制互联网搜索市场竞争企业，蓄意降低对手链接排名，这可能迫使谷歌披露一些内部运作的详情。
研究公司Strategy Analytics分析师马丁·奥劳森（Martin Olausson）称，此事可能陷入僵局，因网络搜索算法乃谷歌的生存之本。如果欧盟确认谷歌滥用市场主导地位，便会责令该公司调整搜索方法或处以最高为年营收10%的罚金。
谷歌面临操纵网站搜索结果排名的指控。随着公司日益壮大，谷歌开始提供一些自己网站的搜索内容，而这些在搜索结果中排名的往往比较靠前，从而导致要求该公司进一步透明搜索结果算法的呼声高涨。本月初，欧盟委员会就谷歌是否滥用在搜索市场的主导地位展开正式调查。
此外，谷歌还面临降低竞争对手服务链接搜索结果排名、阻止广告合作伙伴在竞争对手网站投放广告并对客户转移广告数据到其他平台设置障碍的指责。博客网站Search Engine Land的网络顾问及编辑格雷格·斯特灵（Greg Sterling）称，树大招风，谷歌经常面临诸如此类的指责。
树大招风
谷歌在欧洲搜索引擎市场占有庞大份额。根据行业分析公司ComScore，该公司在欧洲搜索引擎市场所占份额约为77%。欧盟委员会本月证实，已经从德国竞争当局接到两起针对谷歌的投诉。谷歌随后表示，会配合欧盟进行调查。
面对这些投诉，谷歌披露了一些确定搜索结果排名的算法指导。该公司发言人亚当·科瓦切维奇（Adam Kovacevich）通过电邮称，“公司已经提供了许多有关搜索结果排名的算法指导，同时还会不断更新以便让搜索排名更透明。但披露具体细节对搜索引擎并无帮助，而且还会伤害我们的用户。”
参与投诉谷歌的包括英国价格比较网站Foundem及微软旗下的德国价格比较网站Ciao等。Foundem表示，他们并不是想让谷歌公布算法详情，只是想让该公司将网站搜索结果排名的根据原理透明化。
能否躲过一劫？
欧盟委员会对微软、苹果及英特尔等一些美国科技巨头一向不手软，曾经向微软开出过16.8亿美元的巨额罚单，现在谷歌也步其后尘遭遇调查。
哥伦比亚商学院教授布雷特·高登（Brett Gordo）称，欧盟委员会面临的主要挑战是证明谷歌滥用在搜索市场的主导地位伤害了一定的网站。
此前，法国反垄断机构警告谷歌勿要滥用在线广告市场的主要地位。谷歌的应对之策是承诺进一步明确并透明其AdWords广告政策。Hogan Lovells律师事务所合伙人斯托弗·汤玛斯（Christopher Thoma）称，在欧盟调查一事上，谷歌可能采用类似的应对策略。但问题的核心并不是搜索结果排名的算法，而是谷歌能否做出一些让欧盟委员会放心的调整。
Clifford Chance律师事务所合伙人托马斯·文耶（Thomas Vinje）指出，可以确定的是，谷歌面临的压力会越来越大。欧盟委员会展开正式调查可能还会引出其它指控，此事可能需要时段时日才能了结。（姜雪）

description.hltext_display: Kan någon ha kört så full så långt? Sandviken - 21 dec Kan någon så berusad person verkligen ha kört bil så långt? Gävle tingsrätt tvivlade och det bidrog till att en Sandvikenbo på tisdagen friades från ett rattfylleriåtal. Kommentera (1)
description.content:
Sandvikenbon ringde själv polisen och väntade in patrullen vid en kraschad bil vid Axmartavlan i september. Han var mycket berusad och lämnade otydliga uppgifter till polisen. Han sa att en annan namngiven person hade kört bilen, men sen fått lift med en Audi från olycksplatsen. Men han sa också att han själv hade kört.
Tingsrätten underkänner utredningen som ligger till grund för åtalet. Vid det första förhöret var Sandvikenbon mycket berusade och det han sa då inte tillförlitligt. Nästa förhör hölls inte förrän flera veckor senare och har därför också ett lågt bevisvärde.
Mycket talar för att det var han som körde, anser tingsrätten. Men bristerna i utredningen gör att det saknas bevisning.
Tingsrätten kommer fram till att även den höga alkoholhalten, 2,34 promille, talar för att Sandvikenbon kan vara oskyldig. Han är enligt frivårdens utredning inte alkoholberoende och därmed sätter tingsrätten frågetecken för om en person som var så berusad verkligen var i stånd att kör bil från Bollnäs till Axmartavlan.
Här kan du dela artikeln till sociala medier Stäng Fullast kör och erkänn för fanken då klarar man sig????????????

description.hltext_display: Whatâs best deterrent?
description.content:
It’s good to read that some state legislators have discovered the economic cost of maintaining the death penalty in North Carolina.
It is, however, puzzling to read Rep. “Skip” Stam’s comment that “when you don’t have a death penalty, you don’t deter homicides.”
It’s my understanding statistics show fewer homicides per capita in states without the death penalty than in those with it.
One would think facing life imprisonment with no possibility of parole might be as effective a deterrent as the death penalty.
Richard G. Cox

description.hltext_display: Heartbeat International Foundation and BIOTRONIK: Big Hearts in Big Business
description.content:
, Inc. (HBI), a 501 c 3 not-for-profit organization, operating in 22 countries around the world, is proud to announce the first life saved as a result of the strategic partnership with and BIOTRONIK recently achieved a major milestone and victory in the fight to save lives with the successful implant of a donated BIOTRONIK pacemaker in a seven year old girl named, Yuleisy Danila Banos Peraldo, from the country of Ecuador. ?It is only through the generosity and humanitarian efforts of a company such as BIOTRONIK that we are able to accomplish our mission of saving lives around the world. HBI is fortunate that our industry understands the time sensitivity of responding to patients in dire medical need located in the poor regions around the globe?, said Dr. Benedict Maniscalco, Chairman and CEO of HBI. ?There is no greater reward than when a child?s parents look you in the eyes and thank you for saving their baby?s life. This is why HBI exists, and why having a corporate partner like BIOTRONIK literally means whether or not we can continue to save more lives?, said Dr. Attilio Birga the Chairman of Heartbeat International Ecuador. HBI?s commitment to saving lives around the world goes hand in hand with BIOTRONIK?s tradition of humanitarian clinical support. It is only through the efforts of bold committed leaders focused on a common goal, that truly anything can be accomplished. ?This young patient in Ecuador represents all we could ever hope for in our donations to . We are proud of these first steps forward in our mission to deliver lifesaving devices to patients such as Yuleisy who would otherwise have little hope in such poor regions of the world,? said Marlou Janssen, Global Vice President of Marketing and Sales at BIOTRONIK. ?All of us at BIOTRONIK are thankful for the opportunity to partner with HBI, and the chance to further demonstrate our commitment to excellence for life - to patients, families and communities in need.? The following link leads to further information on this topic: HBI+BIOTRONIK About , Inc. (HBI) is a charitable nonprofit foundation and a member of the Independent Charities of America. HBI?s mission is to save lives globally by providing cardiovascular implantable devices and treatment to the needy people of the world, free of charge.
www.heartbeatsaveslives.com
About BIOTRONIK As one of the world?s leading cardiovascular medical device companies, with several million implanted devices, BIOTRONIK is represented in over 100 countries with its global workforce of more than 5,600 employees. Known for having its fingers on the pulse of the medical community, BIOTRONIK assesses the challenges physicians face and provides the best solutions for all phases of patient care, ranging from diagnosis and treatment to patient management. Quality, innovation and clinical excellence define BIOTRONIK and its growing success?and deliver confidence and peace of mind to physicians and their patients worldwide.
www.biotronik.com

description.hltext_display: 黑龙丹东演唱会屡出奇招 水晶镶钻话筒首度亮相
description.content:
将于12月24日、25日在丹东联通体育馆举行的“国泰之夜——《黑龙·回心转意2010全国巡回演唱会》”已经正式进入紧张的倒计时阶段。为了丹东演唱会的圆满举行，主办方及歌手黑龙本人更是煞费苦心，不仅从舞台效果及曲目编排上下足了功夫，连歌手黑龙现场手持的话筒也是独一无二的珍品。
被誉为“伤情教父”的黑龙已经在娱乐圈打拼了十几年，累积了不少大家耳熟能详的歌曲，如《回心转意》、《我爱你你却爱着他》、《好兄弟》等经典佳作。此次黑龙丹东演唱会除了“固定曲”外，刚刚发行的新专辑《戒了烟戒了你》中的一些大获好评的歌曲也列入歌单之中。更有知情人透露，黑龙已经确定加唱一首刚刚制作完成从未示众的单曲，这首歌继承了黑龙一贯的伤情曲风，歌词打动人心，所有工作人员听过后都连声称赞。
此次演唱会，黑龙称作“比生命都重要”的另一音乐法宝“水晶话筒”也将现身。昨天这只话筒已被运送到场馆的保险柜中保存，等待演唱会开始的一刻。这个由美国著名音响公司为黑龙量身订做的话筒，能充分展现黑龙的独特音色。使用了3000多颗施华洛世奇水晶，花费了两个多月的时间一颗一颗粘上去的，是独一无二的珍品。如同黑龙的声音一样，散发着无穷的魅力，耀眼夺目。
据悉，演唱会的音响、灯光、舞美、道具等部门，昨晚已经顺利进入场馆装台以及开始前期准备工作。动感夺目、造型独特的舞台雏形已闪耀而出，封闭排练半年多的黑龙以及他的专属乐队24日平安夜、25日圣诞节，连续两晚将在这里共同完成他们的音乐梦想。而主办方对此次演唱会的嘉宾仍持保密态度，只坦言：“本月23日将进行演唱会的整体彩排，所有的灯光音响以及视频设备也将进行最后一次调试。”(文/雪若)

description.hltext_display: Rights court rules for 2 Mexican environmentalists
description.content:
The Costa Rica-based court says the government should pay $27,500 apiece to activists Teodoro Cabrera and Rodolfo Montiel.
It also says Mexico should investigate claims the men were tortured, punish those responsible and institute training and rights programs to avoid future violations.
Advertisement
Soldiers arrested the two for allegedly growing marijuana and carrying illegal weapons. The men say they are innocent and were arrested because of their activism. They were pardoned after 2 1/2 years in jail.
Mexico's Interior Department pledged Tuesday to obey the court's ruling.

description.hltext_display: Stephen Jones faces longer time out of action
description.content:
by Gareth Griffiths, Western Mail
WALES outside-half Stephen Jones will be out of action for longer than anticipated after damaging knee ligaments 11 days ago in a Heineken Cup match against Treviso.
The Scarlets fly-half now faces a race to be fit for his region’s crucial Heineken Cup encounter at home to Leicester Tigers on the weekend of January 14-16 having received the results of a new scan.
Originally it was predicted Jones would miss three to four weeks from the time he actually sustained the injury.
However, he should be fit in time to be in contention for a place in the Six Nations opener against England on February 4.
“We have had the scan results and it is anything between three or four weeks from now,” confirmed Scarlets head coach Nigel Davies.
“That can change and there is always some fluctuation between the best and worst case scenarios.
“But we feel we have plenty of cover in that position. Rhys Priestland has done exceptionally well for us and has fronted-up for the last 12 months.”
Priestland has recovered from the calf injury he sustained in the 38-15 victory over Treviso last Saturday and should be fit for the Boxing Day derby against the Ospreys at the Liberty Stadium.
The Scarlets will give late fitness tests to captain Matthew Rees, former Australian No 8 David Lyons and Wales centre Jonathan Davies, who has returned to training this week following a three-month absence with an ankle injury.
The Scarlets coach has revealed he is set to keep faith in his talented youngsters after announcing the region will not be dipping into the transfer market to solve the tighthead injury crisis.
Peter Edwards, Rhys Thomas and Deacon Manu are all currently on the casualty list, with youngster Simon Gardiner holding the fort during the Heineken Cup victories against Treviso.
And Davies will continue to keep faith with Gardiner rather than push the boat out for a star-name signing like Scottish and Lions prop Euan Murray.
“We are going to back ourselves to develop the young talent in the front row,” added Davies.
“It has worked for us in other areas and I don’t see why it can’t work for us in this area.”

description.hltext_display: Death toll from Mexico crude-oil blast rises to 29
description.content:
People stand by coffins containing the remains of people killed by the oil pipeline explosion during a mass at a church in San Martin Texmelucan, Mexico, Monday Dec. 20, 2010. The Sunday explosion in San Martin Texmelucan laid waste to parts of the central Mexican city, incinerating people, cars, houses and trees as gushing crude turned streets into flaming rivers. At least 28 people were killed, 13 of them children, in a disaster authorities blame on oil thieves. (AP Photo/Alexandre Meneghini)
People bury a victim of the oil pipeline explosion in a cemetery in San Geronimo, Mexico, Monday Dec. 20, 2010. The Sunday explosion in the nearby town of San Martin Texmelucan laid waste to parts of the central Mexican city, incinerating people, cars, houses and trees as gushing crude turned streets into flaming rivers. At least 28 people were killed, 13 of them children, in a disaster authorities blame on oil thieves. (AP Photo/Alexandre Meneghini)
The death toll from a massive crude-oil explosion that laid waste to parts of a central Mexican city has risen to 29.
Authorities in Puebla state say they located the remains of a baby in the arms of one of the other 28 victims.
Sunday's blast in San Martin Texmelucan, believed to be caused by oil thieves, also injured 52 and damaged or destroyed 115 homes.
Advertisement
Puebla state government spokesman Noe Torres said Tuesday that six of the injured remained hospitalized, five in grave condition.
The explosion occurred when crude began gushing from a state-owned Petroleos Mexicanos pipeline into a city street and river, igniting everything in its path. Investigators found a hole in the pipeline and equipment for extracting crude.

description.hltext_display: Jake Gyllenhaal bedelft Taylor Swift onder de diamanten
description.content: Acteur Jake Gyllenhaal heeft het zwaar te pakken voor zijn negen jaar jonge vriendin, de Amerikaanse countryzangeres Taylor Swift. De filmster gaf de blondine een oogverblindende witgouden armband bezet met diamanten voor haar 21e verjaardag. Het juweel kostte hem maar liefst 100.000 dollar. De acteur uit "Brokeback Mountain" en de zangeres zouden sinds oktober een stel zijn. De twee vierden Thanksgiving samen en werden al meermaals in elkaars gezelschap gespot op koffie-uitstapjes in New York en Tennessee. Swift vierde haar 21e verjaardag op 13 december. Gyllenhaal haalde de inspiratie voor een van zijn geschenkjes uit hun gedeelde voorliefde voor cafeïne. "Ze houden allebei van koffie. Hij heeft haar dus 10 kilogram van de beste koffie in het land, een koffiemolen en een koffiezetapparaat cadeau gedaan", vertelde een vriend van het stel in het magazine In Touch Weekly. "Hij heeft ook zelf een verjaardagskaartje in elkaar geknutseld." Maar de kers op de taart was de met diamanten bezette armband ter waarde van 100.000 dollar. "Het is een juweel dat ze op de Oscars zou kunnen dragen. Het kostte Jake een klein fortuin, maar hij wilde iets speciaals doen voor haar verjaardag."

description.hltext_display: Hyundai/Kia share top spot for safety 2011-IIHS
description.content:
* Redesigned vehicles score higher this year
* Hyundai/Kia fast-growing in U.S. market
WASHINGTON Dec 22 (Reuters) - Fast growing Korean manufacturer Hyundai Motor (005380.KS) and its Kia Motors (000270.KS) affiliate shared the top spot for crash safety in a broad review of 2011 models.
Volkswagen (VOWG.DE) and its luxury Audi brand also were among the 66 passenger cars and sport utilities garnering the highest ratings published by the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety (IIHS).
General Motors Co (GM.N), Ford Motor Co (F.N) and Toyota Motor Co (7203.T)(TM.N) also scored high in the annual review of front, side and rear crashworthiness. Head restraint and rollover protection also were measured.
No small pickups qualified for top ratings. Large pickups will be tested later.
Tougher criteria in the past two years due to the addition of a roof strength requirement and electronic stability control prompted some automakers to redesign vehicles so they would score higher in the IIHS review.
"Automakers deserve credit for quickly rising to meet the more challenging criteria," said Adrian Lund, the insurance safety group's president. "That gives consumers shopping for a safer new car or SUV plenty of choices to consider."
Hyundai and Kia reversed poor roof crush ratings a year ago for the Tucson and its small SUV twin, the Kia Sportage. Hyundai also improved the roof on the midsize Santa Fe SUV and the redesigned Sonata, a midsized car.
The Korean manufacturers are growing fast in the U.S. market where they both rank in the Top 10 for sales and are taking business away from established Japanese competitors.
Hyundai and Kia each nearly doubled sales in November from the year-ago period and their business combined was just behind Chrysler Group, which is run by Italy's Fiat SpA (FIA.MI).
Chrysler added torso bags to its redesigned Jeep Grand Cherokee to improve side crash protection. The redesigned Volkswagen Touareg was the only large SUV to earn a top rating. The Chevy Cruze small car was also a top pick with 10 standard airbags.
The Ford Explorer registered a top safety pick for the first time and the Ford Fiesta was the only minicar to earn that rating.
More than 26,000 people were killed on U.S. roads last year in front and side crashes and rollovers, government safety figures show. Rear crashes usually are not fatal but result in a large number of injuries.
The insurance institute is a non-profit research and communications group funded by auto insurers and focused on evaluating crash safety. (Reporting by John Crawley; editing by Carol Bishopric)

description.hltext_display: Mondial des clubs: Trentino et Fenerbahçe au sommet
description.content:
Pour la deuxième année consécutive, le Trentino Volley s'est adjugé le mondial des clubs, organisé à Doha au Qatar. En finale, les Italiens ont dominé les Polonais de Belchatow, en quatre manches (25-22, 25-19, 20-25, 25-15). Chez les dames, les Turques de Fenerbahçe n'ont fait qu'une bouchée des Brésiliennes de Sollys Osasco, tenantes du titre (25-23, 25-22, 25-17).

description.hltext_display: Retailers wish for Christmas miracle
description.content:
West Australian retailers hope shoppers take advantage of extended trading hours before Christmas and spend big on Boxing Day after a slow start to the festive season.
Retail Traders Association of WA executive director Wayne Spencer says the sales on Boxing Day, the biggest retail trading day of the year, will be vital for struggling retailers this year."It's make or break for the retailers," he told AAP.
"The consumer is certainly alert to the value out there and alert to what they want.
"We just hope they spend some money, not frivolously, but within their means."
Mr Spencer predicts WA's spend will slip from $2.81 billion last year to $2.8 billion this year.
He said despite there being an additional 52,000 people in WA, the spend was likely to be down, close to 10 per cent a person.
Mr Spencer said some retailers were struggling more than others, including those selling household goods.
"The larger discretionary spend is certainly being affected," he said.
"Up until last week it was what I would call soft, and others might call it `patchy', but it will hopefully pick up."
The Australian Retailers Association (ARA) says more than 65 per cent of retailers nationally are trading worse than the same time last year.
Executive director Russell Zimmerman said retailers would be hoping for a boost in sales in the final days before Christmas to meet projections of $39.9 billion in national retail sales for the Christmas trading period.
The Australian National Retail Association (ANRA) has had feedback that sales just a few days out from Christmas have been "subdued".
"Retailers are seeing subdued sales, with hope of an uptick this week with people taking advantage of extended trading hours," ANRA chief executive Margy Osmond told AAP.
"(In Perth), 75 per cent of people will be out shopping up a storm with the longer hours they don't normally have access to, so WA shops may see a surge this week.
"However, sales overall are subdued on this time last year, which is in keeping with predictions of a flat Christmas period."

description.hltext_display: 九天高烧抢拍《伤雪》MV 雪景戏夺人眼球
description.content:
近日，由于《伤雪》这首歌的良好的歌迷反应及需求，歌曲MV的拍摄也在加紧进行中。据悉九天为了拍好外景戏，不想却惹来发烧，但为了早日让这部MV与歌迷见面，他带病拍戏，尤其是最出彩的雪景戏效果非常好。
现在已经到了寒冬，天气凛冽气温极低，然而就是在这样艰苦的气候条件下，为了早日完成《伤雪》MV的拍摄，与观众早日见面，九天不得不在零下二十多度的严寒气候下拍戏，哪知长时间的辛苦最后换来发烧三十九度。虽然身体条件不佳，但是为了赶进度九天带病工作，并且对任何拍摄细节都不遗余力，这样的精神深深感动了一起同事的人，纷纷称赞九天作为艺人的敬业素质。
而在拍摄MV最关键的雪景戏时，哪知苦等数日的雪花迟迟不见踪影，这让已经守候了许久的摄制组着急万分。最后迫不得已，想出了人工造雪的办法，来应对这次的拍摄需求。没有想到的是，最后出来的效果却非常好，将雪天里的唯美氛围营造的异常完美。
据悉，这部MV将于不久后正式在各大视频门户同步上线，届时大家将看到一部高质量的视觉精品。

description.hltext_display: SKorea to stage firing drills near land border
description.content:
South Korean Marines patrol along the seashore on Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Wednesday, Dec. 22, 2010. (AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)
South Korean marines stand guard as they wait their fellow soldiers to return their base after patrolling along the seashore on Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Wednesday, Dec. 22, 2010. (AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)
South Korean marines on patrol make their way along the seashore on Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Wednesday, Dec. 22, 2010. (AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)
A government ship sails past the South Korean Navy's floating base as the sun rises near Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Wednesday, Dec. 22, 2010. (AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)
** ADDS AP SIGNOFF ** South Korean marines stand guard as they wait their fellow soldiers to return their base after patrolling along on Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Wednesday, Dec. 22, 2010. (AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)
A South Korean marine checks his gas mask at a shelter as South Korea fired live artillery in a drill on Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Monday, Dec. 20, 2010. South Korea fired artillery in a 90-minute drill from a front-line island Monday and launched fighter jets to deter attacks after North Korea warned of catastrophic retaliation for the maneuvers. (AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)
South Korean residents take a shelter on Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Monday, Dec. 20, 2010. South Korea fired artillery in a 90-minute drill from a front-line island Monday and launched fighter jets to deter attacks after North Korea warned of catastrophic retaliation for the maneuvers. (AP Photo/Korea Pool) KOREA OUT
In this Feb. 2010 picture shows South Korea's K-9 self-propelled gun howitzers fire during their military exercise in Yanggu, north of Seoul, South Korea. South Korea fired artillery in a 90-minute drill from a front-line island Monday, Dec. 20, 2010, and launched fighter jets to deter attacks after North Korea warned of catastrophic retaliation for the maneuvers. The Defense Ministry said the artillery drills would last about two hours and involve several types of weapons, including K-9 self-propelled guns, ministry spokesman Kim Min-seok told reporters, according to his office. (AP Photo/ Yonhap) KOREA OUT
A South Korean Marine explains how to use gas mask to residents at a shelter on Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Monday, Dec. 20, 2010. South Korea fired artillery in a 90-minute drill from a front-line island Monday and launched fighter jets to deter attacks after North Korea warned of catastrophic retaliation for the maneuvers. (AP Photo/Korea Pool) KOREA OUT
South Korean residents wear their gas masks at a shelter on Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Monday, Dec. 20, 2010. South Korea fired artillery in a 90-minute drill from a front-line island Monday and launched fighter jets to deter attacks after North Korea warned of catastrophic retaliation for the maneuvers. (AP Photo/Korea Pool) KOREA OUT
South Korean residents and journalists gather at a shelter as South Korea fired live artillery in a drill on Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Monday, Dec. 20, 2010. South Korea fired artillery in a 90-minute drill from the front-line island Monday and launched fighter jets to deter attacks after North Korea warned of catastrophic retaliation for the maneuvers. (AP Photo/Korea Pool) KOREA OUT
South Korean marines patrol along on Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010. North Korea backed off threats to retaliate against South Korea for military drills Monday and reportedly offered concessions on its nuclear program _ signs it was looking to lower the temperature on the Korean peninsula after weeks of soaring tensions. (AP Photo/ Ahn Young-joon)
A platoon of South Korean marines patrols along the seashore on Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010. North Korea backed off threats to retaliate against South Korea for military drills Monday and reportedly offered concessions on its nuclear program _ signs it was looking to lower the temperature on the Korean peninsula after weeks of soaring tensions. (AP Photo/ Ahn Young-joon)
In this image made from Associated Press Television News video, New Mexico Gov. Bill Richardson, left, is greeted by Kim Yong Dae, vice president of Presidium of Supreme People's Assembly, before their meeting in Pyongyang, North Korea, Monday, Dec. 20, 2010. Richardson, a frequent unofficial envoy to North Korea and former U.S. ambassador to the U.N., is on a four-day visit to Pyongyang. (AP Photo/Associated Press Television News)
New Mexico Gov. Bill Richardson speaks to a reporter in Pyongyang, North Korea Monday, Dec. 20, 2010. Gov. Richardson postponed his return as his flight was canceled due to fog, Kyodo News reported Monday. Richardson, a frequent unofficial envoy to North Korea and former U.S. ambassador to the U.N., held meetings with top leaders in the foreign ministry and military during a four-day visit to Pyongyang. (AP Photo/Kyodo News) JAPAN OUT, MANDATORY CREDIT, FOR COMMERCIAL USE ONLY IN NORTH AMERICA
South Korean President Lee Myung-bak, left, talks with Defense Minister Kim Kwan-jin before a cabinet meeting at the presidential Blue House in Seoul, South Korea, Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010. North Korea backed off threats to retaliate against South Korea for military drills and reportedly offered concessions on its nuclear program _ signs it was looking to lower the temperature on the Korean peninsula after weeks of soaring tensions. (AP Photo/ Jo Bo-hee, Yonhap) KOREA OUT
South Korean marines patrol along on Yeonpyeong island, South Korea, Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010. North Korea backed off threats to retaliate against South Korea for military drills Monday and reportedly offered concessions on its nuclear program _ signs it was looking to lower the temperature on the Korean peninsula after weeks of soaring tensions. (AP Photo/ Ahn Young-joon)
A man calls on his mobile phone from the Imjingak Pavilion near the border village of Panmunjom in Paju, South Korea, Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010. South Korean President Lee Myung-bak gathered his national security leaders for strategic talks Tuesday as troops braced for possible North Korean retaliation a day after conducting artillery drills on Yeonpyeong island the North bombed last month. (AP Photo/Ng Han Guan)
A 100-foot-tall (30-meter-tall) steel Christmas tree is lit at the western mountain peak known as Aegibong in Gimpo, South Korea, Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010. The Christmas lights went on again for the first time in seven years. (AP Photo/Lee Jin-man)
A South Korean man reacts as he watches a live TV breaking news about South Korea's live fire artillery drill at Seoul train station in Seoul, South Korea, Monday, Dec. 20, 2010. South Korea fired live artillery Monday in the drill from a front-line island where similar exercises sparked a deadly North Korean bombardment last month, pressing forward in defiance of the North's warnings to attack again. South Korea said it launched fighter jets to deter any North Korean attacks during the hour-long drills on Yeonpyeong. (AP Photo/ Lee Jin-man)

description.hltext_display: Blött ska det vara. Moa Larsdotter, fem år, kunde inte få nog av den lilla rutschkanan. Nöjda gäster i nyöppnat badhus Sandviken - 00:00 Sandviken Äntligen var ordet. Till glädje för många besökare har nu portarna äntligen slagits upp till Pa
description.content:
Allt slit var värt det. Zaradesht Bekir konstaterade att allt jobb han lagt ner på Café Sälen helt klart varit värt det när besökare efter besökare kom med sina lovord.
Det flyter. Linus Johnsson och Robin Afvander kunde inte få nog av vatten under tisdagen,
Blött ska det vara. Moa Larsdotter, fem år, kunde inte få nog av den lilla rutschkanan.
Under tisdagsmorgonen var det dags. Den renoverade äventyrsdelen på Parkbadet och Café Sälen fick åter igen beträdas av besökare. Efter månader av olidlig väntan kunde Linus Johnsson äntligen flyta med i badhusets strömmar. – Forsen sprutar mycket mer än tidigare, säger han.
Tillsammans med sina kompisar hade han testat allt som gick att prova på.
På tillfälligt besök från Älvkarleby hade även Helene Hellkvist och dottern Moa Larsdotter, 5 år, hunnit uppleva det nya.
– Vi brukade åka hit en gång i månaden tidigare, så det blev en glad överraskning att de öppnade den här delen just i dag när vi är här, säger Helene Hellkvist.
En glad överraskning blev det också för den nye kaféarrendatorn Zaradesht Bekir. – Jag var så nervös inför i dag att jag knappt sovit något. Men alla har varit så positiva, säger han.
Nu får alla badgäster chansen att njuta av ett helt öppet badhus innan det är dags för renoveringen av simbassängen 10 januari. Men fram tills dess är det öppna och nyrenoverade dörrar som gäller.
Här kan du dela artikeln till sociala medier Stäng

description.hltext_display: Gays donât merit getting special consideration
description.content:
Gays in the military should not cause any detrimental effects on the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq.
If you really think about it, there are gays working in every field throughout our society. They are working in education teaching our children. Gays work in the health field. There are even gay ministers and gay doctors.
I bet if you painted every gay person purple for one day and you found out how many of your friends and family or co-workers are actually gay, it would blow your mind. As long as you don’t know, it doesn’t bother you or affect your relationship with that fellow-employee or family member.
It is when the gay community tries to enact all of these laws pertaining to gays rights — like they’re something special — that the thought of working with someone who is gay starts to bother you.
There’s no need for “don’t ask, don’t tell.” It will definitely cause soldiers to look at their fellow soldiers differently. Hopefully, the president will veto it because there truly is no need for it.
Steven M. Shelton

description.hltext_display: Lebanon-based Cracker Barrel takes Southern fare to Northern borders
description.content:
SOUTH PORTLAND, Maine Southern-fried restaurant chain Cracker Barrel is finding hungry customers in the land of lobster, steamers and baked beans. Cracker Barrel General Store's first restaurant in Maine represents the chain's northernmost foray along the East Coast. And Mainers seem to be taking a shine to the chicken and dumplings, biscuits and sawmill gravy, and other Southern staples such as turnip greens, pork barbecue and grits.
Well, scratch the grits.
"I'll try anything once, but I'm not trying those grits. No way," Sandra Butler of South Portland said with a chuckle, after giving fried okra and turnip greens a try.
Southern cooking knows no boundaries, apparently. The South Portland restaurant was running 25 percent ahead of projections when it opened last month, according to the company.
Decorated with antiques, rocking chairs and checkerboards, the restaurant presents a familiar face to New Englanders who've traveled through Florida and other parts of the South where Cracker Barrels are a highway fixture. And they've developed a loyal following, even far north of the Mason-Dixon line.
Chris and Anne Taylor of Topsham readily confess that they used to drive two hours to eat at a Cracker Barrel in Massachusetts before the South Portland restaurant opened. Now the restaurant is only 30 miles away, and they've made it a Wednesday night ritual to dine there for "date night."
"The nice thing about a place like this is you get to experience a little taste of another part of the country cuisine that you don't get if you grow up in Maine," he said.
Different fare
New England isn't exactly known for daring cuisine.
Staples include baked cod and haddock, pulled from the North Atlantic. In the summer, there are steamed mussels and clams. And of course, New England is known for chowder, lobster and baked bean suppers.
Cracker Barrel's menu is different. It features things such as country-fried steak, fried chicken, fried chicken livers and catfish; fried apples, pinto beans, turnip greens and hashbrown casserole; for dessert there's a plethora of cobblers. (2 of 2)The Tennessee-based restaurant chain got its start in 1969 when Danny Evans opened a restaurant with an eye to recreating the country store of yesteryear, when crackers were delivered in barrels and barrels were recycled as checkerboard tables. The South Portland restaurant can seat 207, but the company markets the modern Cracker Barrel as a place where customers can find time to slow down.
Until the early 1990s, the company stuck mostly to its base in the South, but now it has 597 restaurants in 42 states.
The South Portland restaurant opens as customers around the country have shown greater willingness over the past six to eight months to dine out after a disastrous couple of years in which restaurants were hard-hit by bankruptcies, said R.J. Hottovy, senior analyst at Chicago-based Morningstar, an investment research firm.
"There's a willingness to spend more, or to allocate more dollars to dining out," he said. "Generally speaking, we have seen traffic improve in the casual dining space."
With $2.4 billion in revenue for its last fiscal year, the company is looking for additional opportunities to expand and hasn't ruled out more locations in Maine.
That'd be just fine with Elizabeth Grant of Westbrook. The homey feel and comfort food take her back to a simpler time.
"What draws us to it is that it's just like home cooking. Even though it's a big restaurant, a big chain of restaurants, they still capture that," she said. "It's nice."

event_or_fact.property: Even though it's a big restaurant, a big chain of restaurants, they still capture that; It's nice.
The nice thing about a place like this is you get to experience a little taste of another part of the country cuisine that you don't get if you grow up in Maine
There's a willingness to spend more, or to allocate more dollars to dining out; Generally speaking, we have seen traffic improve in the casual dining space.

description.hltext_display: Su supuesta muerte será investigada
description.content:
La Fiscalía de Cádiz ha decidido trasladar a la Policía las denuncias de varias familias cuyos bebés fueron dados por muertos durante las décadas de los 60 y 70. A ninguna les permitieron ver el cadáver de su&nbsp; bebé y sospechan que hay irregularidades en los certificados de defunción. Algunos incluso han comprobado, al ir a trasladar los restos mortales, que en los nichos donde creían tener enterrados a sus bebés no había nada. La Fiscalía gaditana, había abierto hace poco diligencias informativas, estaba recabando&nbsp; información para asegurarse que los casos no habían prescrito. En la reunión que la fiscal, Ángeles Ayuso, ha mantenido con las familias les ha comunicado que seguirá adelante con la investigación y que trasladará a la Policía sus denuncias. Autor: videosatlas
Tags: recabando&ampnbsp, Algunos, fiscal, comprobado, trasladará, estaba, bebés, informativas, había, tener
Añadido: 2010-12-22 09:06:03

description.hltext_display: Filipino gunmen free 2 Malaysians after 10 months
description.content:
Malaysian national Lai Wong Chun second right and Chen Yui Chung second left, step out of an ambulance at the police hospital Wednesday, Dec. 22, 2010 in suburban Quezon City north of Manila, Philippines. Filipino gunmen with ties to al-Qaida linked militants have freed the two Malaysian laborers from 10 months of jungle captivity. (AP Photo/Pat Roque)
A police officer shows the way to Malaysian national Lai Wong Chun, center, and Chen Yui Chung as they step out of an ambulance at the police hospital Wednesday, Dec. 22, 2010 in suburban Quezon City, north of Manila, Philippines. Filipino gunmen with ties to al-Qaida linked militants have freed the two Malaysian laborers from 10 months of jungle captivity. (AP Photo/Pat Roque)
Filipino gunmen with ties to al-Qaida-linked militants, under pressure from pursuing police commandos, have freed two Malaysian laborers from 10 months of jungle captivity, police said Wednesday.
The hostages were seized Feb. 8 from a seaweed farm in Malaysia's Sabah state and whisked away in a speedboat to nearby Philippine waters in a pattern similar to past kidnappings-for-ransom blamed on the notorious terrorist group Abu Sayyaf.
Police commandos, who have been searching for the captives, recovered the two men near Bongao town in the southernmost island province of Tawi-Tawi late Tuesday, national police chief Raul Bacalzo told reporters.
He said the gunmen abandoned the hostages after they were encircled by government forces. The kidnappers escaped and the Malaysians, Chen Yui Chung, 48, and Lai Wong Chun, 46, were flown to Manila. They will be turned over to the Malaysian Embassy after being debriefed by Philippine authorities and checked up in a hospital at police headquarters in the capital.
Wearing baseball caps, the two appeared to have lost weight as they walked into a hospital emergency room from an ambulance. One wore combat boots. Policemen kept journalists and photographers from coming near.
Interior Secretary Jessie Robredo said the two told him they were not harmed by their captors and were fed well.
"Thank you very much," Robredo quoted the Malaysians as repeatedly telling officials.
"We're all so happy. This is the best Christmas gift to their families," Robredo told The Associated Press.
The kidnappers had demanded ransom but Robredo said he was unaware of any payment, as was the case with past abductions.
Malaysian and Philippine authorities were initially unsure if the hostages were still in Malaysia or the southern Philippines, where the Abu Sayyaf and other Muslim rebel groups have carried out kidnappings for ransom.
Officials in Tawi-Tawi, about 620 miles (1,000 kilometers) southwest of Manila, had ordered a search in the far-flung province in June after police monitored a cell phone call made by one of the captives to his family in Malaysia, according to a Philippine security official.
The official, who helped oversee the search, declined to be named because he was not authorized to talk to the media.
"They were brought from Tawi-Tawi to Jolo and back and we did not know where to look for them," Tawi-Tawi Gov. Sadikul Sahali said.
Chen Yui Chung's brother-in-law, Chong Man Tung, told The Associated Press in June that his relative had called him weeks after the abduction saying the two were being held by gunmen on an unspecified Philippine island.
The kidnappers apparently had moved the captives from Tawi-Tawi to nearby Jolo Island and back to evade the Philippine military and police manhunt, the security official said.
The Abu Sayyaf has gained notoriety for high-profile kidnappings, beheadings and bomb attacks. Battle setbacks, arrests and surrenders have reduced the group's strength to more than 300 from more than 1,000 guerrillas during its heyday in 2000, the military says.
That year the militants abducted 21 Asian workers and Western tourists from Malaysia's Sipadan diving resort and brought them to Jolo. They were freed in batches in exchange for huge ransoms.
Hundreds of U.S. troops have been providing weapons, training and intelligence to Philippine forces in the south for years to help eradicate the Abu Sayyaf, which is on Washington's list of terrorist organizations.
